		</section><title commented="no" id="H01BD58D3AD6F45FA8782E397CA607A08" level-type="subsequent"><enum>I</enum><header display-inline="yes-display-inline">TEN-YEAR DISCRETIONARY CAPS WITH
			 SEQUESTER</header>
			<section commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HFDDE9447A99749969BCEDD481585FE70" section-type="subsequent-section"><enum>101.</enum><header display-inline="yes-display-inline">Enforcing discretionary spending
			 limits</header><text display-inline="no-display-inline">Section 251 of the
			 Balanced Budget and Emergency Deficit Control Act of 1985 is amended to read as
			 follows:</text>
				<quoted-block display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HADA1640841A34C58B130E77FEF8EACBE" style="OLC">
					<section commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HDE8C2A20A8C7450EA2F9D395B7E47B0E" section-type="subsequent-section"><enum>251.</enum><header display-inline="yes-display-inline">Enforcing discretionary spending
				limits</header>
						<subsection commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H21B3672F93DD48D1A75F115203B0CCA3"><enum>(a)</enum><header display-inline="yes-display-inline">Enforcement</header>
							<paragraph commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H379BAF0C0EF74B43AB722328141D0ADB"><enum>(1)</enum><header display-inline="yes-display-inline">Sequestration</header><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">Within 15 calendar days after Congress
				adjourns to end a session there shall be a sequestration to eliminate a
				budget-year breach, if any, within any category.</text>
							</paragraph><paragraph commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF6FD62E6E5BB4F0895894408C9429085"><enum>(2)</enum><header display-inline="yes-display-inline">Eliminating a breach</header><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">Each non-exempt account within a category
				shall be reduced by a dollar amount calculated by multiplying the enacted level
				of sequestrable budgetary resources in that account at that time by the uniform
				percentage necessary to eliminate a breach within that category.</text>
							</paragraph><paragraph commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HAE328F916F74422ABB75AB2ECE2EE871"><enum>(3)</enum><header display-inline="yes-display-inline">Military personnel</header><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">If the President uses the authority to
				exempt any personnel account from sequestration under section 255(f), each
				account within subfunctional category 051 (other than those military personnel
				accounts for which the authority provided under section 255(f) has been
				exercised) shall be further reduced by a dollar amount calculated by
				multiplying the enacted level of non-exempt budgetary resources in that account
				at that time by the uniform percentage necessary to offset the total dollar
				amount by which outlays are not reduced in military personnel accounts by
				reason of the use of such authority.</text>
							</paragraph><paragraph commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HCCE844FB28E748A396077C56366556DE"><enum>(4)</enum><header display-inline="yes-display-inline">Part-year appropriations</header><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">If, on the date specified in paragraph (1),
				there is in effect an Act making or continuing appropriations for part of a
				fiscal year for any budget account, then the dollar sequestration calculated
				for that account under paragraphs (2) and (3) shall be subtracted from—</text>
								<subparagraph commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HC4387BAD67D74F27A15247020AB6F6B0"><enum>(A)</enum><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">the annualized amount otherwise available
				by law in that account under that or a subsequent part-year appropriation;
				and</text>
								</subparagraph><subparagraph commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF6B2B1B9C0154E27BA8B5FD9344CFBBF"><enum>(B)</enum><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">when a full-year appropriation for that
				account is enacted, from the amount otherwise provided by the full-year
				appropriation for that account.</text>
								</subparagraph></paragraph><paragraph commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H398D25D98163498F8021021ECD42C321"><enum>(5)</enum><header display-inline="yes-display-inline">Look-back</header><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">If, after June 30, an appropriation for the
				fiscal year in progress is enacted that causes a breach within a category for
				that year (after taking into account any sequestration of amounts within that
				category), the discretionary spending limits for that category for the next
				fiscal year shall be reduced by the amount or amounts of that breach.</text>
							</paragraph><paragraph commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H4AF37A826C5C4792AC9570BE9E59D78D"><enum>(6)</enum><header display-inline="yes-display-inline">Within-session sequestration</header><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">If an appropriation for a fiscal year in
				progress is enacted (after Congress adjourns to end the session for that budget
				year and before July 1 of that fiscal year) that causes a breach within a
				category for that year (after taking into account any prior sequestration of
				amounts within that category), 15 days later there shall be a sequestration to
				eliminate that breach within that category following the procedures set forth
				in paragraphs (2) through (4).</text>
							</paragraph><paragraph commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H81F48791069C430A945E2D386F3345FC"><enum>(7)</enum><header display-inline="yes-display-inline">Estimates</header>
								<subparagraph commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HEF94726FDAE34F41AC1E7749053D749B"><enum>(A)</enum><header display-inline="yes-display-inline">CBO estimates</header><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">As soon as practicable after Congress
				completes action on any discretionary appropriation, CBO, after consultation
				with the Committees on the Budget of the House of Representatives and the
				Senate, shall provide OMB with an estimate of the amount of discretionary new
				budget authority and outlays for the current year, if any, and the budget year
				provided by that legislation.</text>
								</subparagraph><subparagraph commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H76EDCC0553EF4B85BABBFB9CAB5BB9F2"><enum>(B)</enum><header display-inline="yes-display-inline">OMB estimates and explanation of
				differences</header><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">Not later than 7
				calendar days (excluding Saturdays, Sundays, and legal holidays) after the date
				of enactment of any discretionary appropriation, OMB shall transmit a report to
				the House of Representatives and to the Senate containing the CBO estimate of
				that legislation, an OMB estimate of the amount of discretionary new budget
				authority and outlays for the current year, if any, and the budget year
				provided by that legislation, and an explanation of any difference between the
				2 estimates. If during the preparation of the report OMB determines that there
				is a significant difference between OMB and CBO, OMB shall consult with the
				Committees on the Budget of the House of Representatives and the Senate
				regarding that difference and that consultation shall include, to the extent
				practicable, written communication to those committees that affords such
				committees the opportunity to comment before the issuance of the report.</text>
								</subparagraph><subparagraph commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H0DE766DFC1DB4AC58F7F1717FBF9B548"><enum>(C)</enum><header display-inline="yes-display-inline">Assumptions and guidelines</header><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">OMB estimates under this paragraph shall be
				made using current economic and technical assumptions. OMB shall use the OMB
				estimates transmitted to the Congress under this paragraph. OMB and CBO shall
				prepare estimates under this paragraph in conformance with scorekeeping
				guidelines determined after consultation among the Committees on the Budget of
				the House of Representatives and the Senate, CBO, and OMB.</text>
								</subparagraph><subparagraph commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H6967490850BB420C8D1F3F28626AF8D6"><enum>(D)</enum><header display-inline="yes-display-inline">Annual appropriations</header><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">For purposes of this paragraph, amounts
				provided by annual appropriations shall include any discretionary
				appropriations for the current year, if any, and the budget year in accounts
				for which funding is provided in that legislation that result from previously
				enacted legislation.</text>
								</subparagraph></paragraph></subsection><subsection commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H07510FA52C484F31A470E26F2F39635C"><enum>(b)</enum><header display-inline="yes-display-inline">Adjustments to discretionary spending
				limits</header>
							<paragraph commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HEB90C1086C6E418595271F1198E12D35"><enum>(1)</enum><header display-inline="yes-display-inline">Concepts and definitions</header><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">When the President submits the budget under
				<external-xref legal-doc="usc" parsable-cite="usc/31/1105">section 1105</external-xref> of title 31, United States Code, OMB shall calculate and the
				budget shall include adjustments to discretionary spending limits (and those
				limits as cumulatively adjusted) for the budget year and each outyear to
				reflect changes in concepts and definitions. Such changes shall equal the
				baseline levels of new budget authority and outlays using up-to-date concepts
				and definitions, minus those levels using the concepts and definitions in
				effect before such changes. Such changes may only be made after consultation
				with the Committees on Appropriations and the Budget of the House of
				Representatives and the Senate, and that consultation shall include written
				communication to such committees that affords such committees the opportunity
				to comment before official action is taken with respect to such changes.</text>
							</paragraph><paragraph commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H592E129F2C584BDDB51128834D09D490"><enum>(2)</enum><header display-inline="yes-display-inline">Sequestration reports</header><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">When OMB submits a sequestration report
				under section 254(e), (f), or (g) for a fiscal year, OMB shall calculate, and
				the sequestration report and subsequent budgets submitted by the President
				under <external-xref legal-doc="usc" parsable-cite="usc/31/1105">section 1105(a)</external-xref> of title 31, United States Code, shall include
				adjustments to discretionary spending limits (and those limits as adjusted) for
				the fiscal year and each succeeding year, as follows:</text>
								<subparagraph commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HBE5BDD33711D4FBCBC6F1E06EB898D3A"><enum>(A)</enum><header display-inline="yes-display-inline">Emergency appropriations; overseas
				contingency operations/global war on terrorism</header><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">If, for any fiscal year, appropriations for
				discretionary accounts are enacted that—</text>
									<clause commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H93F8C1844D4E43EE8CBAF1298EE4E304"><enum>(i)</enum><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">the Congress designates as emergency
				requirements in statute on an account by account basis and the President
				subsequently so designates, or</text>
									</clause><clause commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA2E13DE5D319452690151782CAC627E9"><enum>(ii)</enum><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">the Congress designates for Overseas
				Contingency Operations/Global War on Terrorism in statute on an account by
				account basis and the President subsequently so designates,</text>
									</clause><continuation-text commented="no" continuation-text-level="subparagraph">the adjustment shall be the total
				of such appropriations in discretionary accounts designated as emergency
				requirements or for Overseas Contingency Operations/Global War on Terrorism, as
				applicable.</continuation-text></subparagraph><subparagraph commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H407B0A0A28C1472380E92297B6099D2C"><enum>(B)</enum><header display-inline="yes-display-inline">Continuing disability reviews and
				redeterminations</header><clause commented="no" display-inline="yes-display-inline" id="H4A49FEBA65E44881A9B59494FCE83C6D"><enum>(i)</enum><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">If a bill or joint resolution making
				appropriations for a fiscal year is enacted that specifies an amount for
				continuing disability reviews under titles II and XVI of the Social Security
				Act and for the cost associated with conducting redeterminations of eligibility
				under title XVI of the Social Security Act, then the adjustments for that
				fiscal year shall be the additional new budget authority provided in that Act
				for such expenses for that fiscal year, but shall not exceed—</text>
										<subclause commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE63D1704E17C4C91807B55BB1D279FC8" indent="up1"><enum>(I)</enum><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">for fiscal year 2012, $623,000,000 in
				additional new budget authority;</text>
										</subclause><subclause commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB6A4795442EB48F689D899A72C98C1DF" indent="up1"><enum>(II)</enum><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">for fiscal year 2013, $751,000,000 in
				additional new budget authority;</text>

									</clause></subparagraph><subparagraph commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H7A17CE5559884F1B9A5D0435FFAABF08"><enum>(D)</enum><header display-inline="yes-display-inline">Disaster funding</header>
									<clause commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HBCC2A5B310FE409C9DDF9070F5ABC347"><enum>(i)</enum><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">If, for fiscal years 2012 through 2021,

									</clause><clause commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H0AD02CD3ECC247C8B45D7A65381BCFA6"><enum>(iii)</enum><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">For the purposes of this subparagraph, the

									</clause><clause commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HC87E8F8C3B9F4364862A8C2678830081"><enum>(iv)</enum><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">Appropriations considered disaster relief

			</section><section commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H6E56F403E0A1473090E5218390E3E931" section-type="subsequent-section"><enum>102.</enum><header display-inline="yes-display-inline">Definitions</header><text display-inline="no-display-inline">Section 250(c) of the Balanced Budget and
			 Emergency Deficit Control Act of 1985 is amended as follows:</text>
				<paragraph commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H6F706180503846D29319D9CEAC3C3C99"><enum>(1)</enum><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">Strike paragraph (4) and insert the
			 following new paragraph:</text>
					<quoted-block display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H55311B04518D41B2BBE43C86ABC6AD20" style="OLC">
						<paragraph commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA52AAB533B224F3AAF611983BEC20826"><enum>(4)</enum><subparagraph commented="no" display-inline="yes-display-inline" id="H90E7F1DC54D94CB1B16164C8469A7572"><enum>(A)</enum><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">The term <quote>nonsecurity
				category</quote> means all discretionary appropriations not included in the
				security category defined in subparagraph (B).</text>
							</subparagraph><subparagraph commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H4805B5324BA040EF8165F3C8AA294F36" indent="up1"><enum>(B)</enum><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">The term <quote>security category</quote>
				includes discretionary appropriations associated with agency budgets for the
				Department of Defense, the Department of Homeland Security, the Department of
				Veterans Affairs, the National Nuclear Security Administration, the
				intelligence community management account (95–0401–0–1–054), and all budget
				accounts in budget function 150 (international affairs).</text>
							</subparagraph><subparagraph commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H2B9F708BC6B542528B2DB4AACE5FE3BE" indent="up1"><enum>(C)</enum><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">The term <quote>discretionary
				category</quote> includes all discretionary
				appropriations.</text>
							</subparagraph></paragraph><after-quoted-block>.</after-quoted-block></quoted-block>
				</paragraph><paragraph commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA673460C30394587B1539BB4CA1D9223"><enum>(2)</enum><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">In paragraph (8)(C), strike <quote>the food
			 stamp program</quote> and insert <quote>the Supplemental Nutrition Assistance
			 Program</quote>.</text>
				</paragraph><paragraph commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H5476C38FC72E44A7B477DE32044F6EB4"><enum>(3)</enum><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">Strike paragraph (14) and insert the
			 following new paragraph:</text>
					<quoted-block display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HC85D4A0265C9414D9683FCEE6ACCF03B" style="OLC">
						<paragraph commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF8D141EE1B8546EA91C83CDC8E521BF2"><enum>(14)</enum><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">The term <quote>outyear</quote> means a
				fiscal year one or more years after the budget
				year.</text>
						</paragraph><after-quoted-block>.</after-quoted-block></quoted-block>
				</paragraph><paragraph commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H9104648D3932440D879AC08E26EBAAF7"><enum>(4)</enum><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">At the end, add the following new
			 paragraphs:</text>
					<quoted-block display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H809B81E090D044EAA31A9E6935999C9E" style="OLC">
						<paragraph commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H75C9A1875AF34339A593C40568D58171"><enum>(20)</enum><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">The term <quote>emergency</quote> means a
				situation that—</text>
							<subparagraph commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HABC570B1F1E547E5901D6A36ABB1BDA1"><enum>(A)</enum><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">requires new budget authority and outlays
				(or new budget authority and the outlays flowing therefrom) for the prevention
				or mitigation of, or response to, loss of life or property, or a threat to
				national security; and</text>
							</subparagraph><subparagraph commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HCCD8E7A567D842B09702A3D9A14D0013"><enum>(B)</enum><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">is unanticipated.</text>
							</subparagraph></paragraph><paragraph commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H957C17CFB63C41E6927C61BD006FFB3E"><enum>(21)</enum><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">The term <quote>unanticipated</quote> means
				that the underlying situation is—</text>
							<subparagraph commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H4F34CE90EFDB4C03A20EBFE5E936B6A5"><enum>(A)</enum><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">sudden, which means quickly coming into
				being or not building up over time;</text>
							</subparagraph><subparagraph commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H8DF272FC9C564DBAA99110C0D21D3385"><enum>(B)</enum><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">urgent, which means a pressing and
				compelling need requiring immediate action;</text>
							</subparagraph><subparagraph commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HC7478B851FF849349320298ABB504699"><enum>(C)</enum><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">unforeseen, which means not predicted or
				anticipated as an emerging need; and</text>
							</subparagraph><subparagraph commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H5AE9FE66C2D1487A8A45ADEFD91629F5"><enum>(D)</enum><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">temporary, which means not of a permanent
				duration.</text>
							</subparagraph></paragraph><after-quoted-block>.</after-quoted-block></quoted-block>
				</paragraph></section><section commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB3C27BAA8B0E438AB7A99881E645AEA8" section-type="subsequent-section"><enum>103.</enum><header display-inline="yes-display-inline">Reports and orders</header><text display-inline="no-display-inline">Section 254 of the Balanced Budget and
			 Emergency Deficit Control Act of 1985 is amended as follows:</text>
				<paragraph commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HC6D41856E3BE4E22B09BA2954AE9F5F6"><enum>(1)</enum><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">In subsection (c)(2), strike
			 <quote>2002</quote> and insert <quote>2021</quote>.</text>
				</paragraph><paragraph commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H69C8B463F75C4C6EBC11AB419E6F9B36"><enum>(2)</enum><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">At the end of subsection (e), insert
			 <quote>This report shall also contain a preview estimate of the adjustment for
			 disaster funding for the upcoming fiscal year.</quote>.</text>
				</paragraph><paragraph commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H9C3F692BE491435EB80F436812CB35AF"><enum>(3)</enum><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">In subsection (f)(2)(A), strike
			 <quote>2002</quote> and insert <quote>2021</quote>; before the concluding
			 period insert <quote>, including a final estimate of the adjustment for
			 disaster funding</quote>.</text>
				</paragraph></section><section commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF4C7E582ED6343949ABD786E63F8401D" section-type="subsequent-section"><enum>104.</enum><header display-inline="yes-display-inline">Expiration</header>
				<subsection commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HC9DB40C8E12840578226C148F21FCB8A"><enum>(a)</enum><header display-inline="yes-display-inline">Repealer</header><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">Section 275 of the Balanced Budget and
			 Emergency Deficit Control Act of 1985 is repealed.</text>
				</subsection><subsection commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HC6CBFD3CC40E4F00A5B60D25A2BD552B"><enum>(b)</enum><header display-inline="yes-display-inline">Conforming change</header><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">Sections 252(d)(1), 254(c), 254(f)(3), and
			 254(i) of the Balanced Budget and Emergency Deficit Control Act of 1985 shall
			 not apply to the Congressional Budget Office.</text>
				</subsection></section><section commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H2216AD1773FF417CAF6615EB8448794F" section-type="subsequent-section"><enum>105.</enum><header display-inline="yes-display-inline">Amendments to the Congressional Budget and
			 Impoundment Control Act of 1974</header>
				<subsection commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H04F34FDB867E44D99097EB99D9CFB80F"><enum>(a)</enum><header display-inline="yes-display-inline">Adjustments</header><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">Section 314 of the Congressional Budget Act
			 of 1974 is amended as follows:</text>
					<paragraph commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H8A5E9EF15E8846FBBA448740A8840F8A"><enum>(1)</enum><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">Strike subsection (a) and insert the
			 following:</text>
						<quoted-block display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H82292DA9E6904073939315CC1DAD771D" style="OLC">
							<subsection commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H107DA38AB6BE49919FAE052BBCCFD940"><enum>(a)</enum><header display-inline="yes-display-inline">Adjustments</header><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">After the reporting of a bill or joint
				resolution or the offering of an amendment thereto or the submission of a
				conference report thereon, the chairman of the Committee on the Budget of the
				House of Representatives or the Senate may make appropriate budgetary
				adjustments of new budget authority and the outlays flowing therefrom in the
				same amount as required by section 251(b) of the Balanced Budget and Emergency
				Deficit Control Act of
				1985.</text>
							</subsection><after-quoted-block>.</after-quoted-block></quoted-block>
					</paragraph><paragraph commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H8324E7BDBC74493E996F76FBD9BCF388"><enum>(2)</enum><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">Strike subsections (b) and (e) and
			 redesignate subsections (c) and (d) as subsections (b) and (c),
			 respectively.</text>
					</paragraph><paragraph commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H1AF898E4FE944F7FB30DD9A6CD8D2171"><enum>(3)</enum><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">At the end, add the following new
			 subsections:</text>
						<quoted-block display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA5375916DB9C42B1A2427FF28926DEE7" style="OLC">
							<subsection commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H4ACFC13F6B074066A948AA3EF87DB0CC"><enum>(d)</enum><header display-inline="yes-display-inline">Emergencies in the House of
				Representatives</header><text display-inline="yes-display-inline"></text><paragraph commented="no" display-inline="yes-display-inline" id="H7944FAF83A8F4157BC0CBEADCCCD7BEA"><enum>(1)</enum><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">In the House of Representatives, if a
				reported bill or joint resolution, or amendment thereto or conference report
				thereon, contains a provision providing new budget authority and outlays or
				reducing revenue, and a designation of such provision as an emergency
				requirement pursuant to 251(b)(2)(A) of the Balanced Budget and Emergency
				Deficit Control Act of 1985, the chair of the Committee on the Budget of the
				House of Representatives shall not count the budgetary effects of such
				provision for purposes of title III and title IV of the Congressional Budget
				Act of 1974 and the Rules of the House of Representatives.</text>
								</paragraph><paragraph commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HFF419FD0CDC1478CAB6DDDB368B734FC" indent="up1"><enum>(2)</enum><subparagraph commented="no" display-inline="yes-display-inline" id="HA310430FB42E42728DC9B05CC06C3BD9"><enum>(A)</enum><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">In the House of Representatives, if a
				reported bill or joint resolution, or amendment thereto or conference report
				thereon, contains a provision providing new budget authority and outlays or
				reducing revenue, and a designation of such provision as an emergency pursuant
				to paragraph (1), the chair of the Committee on the Budget shall not count the
				budgetary effects of such provision for purposes of this title and title IV and
				the Rules of the House of Representatives.</text>
									</subparagraph><subparagraph commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB42B4F00A111400B9056CF5107D5D08F" indent="up1"><enum>(B)</enum><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">In the House of Representatives, a proposal
				to strike a designation under subparagraph (A) shall be excluded from an
				evaluation of budgetary effects for purposes of this title and title IV and the
				Rules of the House of Representatives.</text>
									</subparagraph><subparagraph commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H653F2B83743F4D34BBE798C49AC0A18A" indent="up1"><enum>(C)</enum><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">An amendment offered under subparagraph (B)
				that also proposes to reduce each amount appropriated or otherwise made
				available by the pending measure that is not required to be appropriated or
				otherwise made available shall be in order at any point in the reading of the
				pending measure.</text>
									</subparagraph></paragraph></subsection><subsection commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H90E41D1A898F4CFBB7D8AF9DCCB1C654"><enum>(e)</enum><header display-inline="yes-display-inline">Enforcement of discretionary spending
				caps</header><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">It shall not be in order
				in the House of Representatives or the Senate to consider any bill, joint
				resolution, amendment, motion, or conference report that would cause the
				discretionary spending limits as set forth in section 251 of the Balanced
				Budget and Emergency Deficit Control Act to be
				exceeded.</text>
							</subsection><after-quoted-block>.</after-quoted-block></quoted-block>
					</paragraph></subsection><subsection commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H1FD95CB6CDC5430896B1118F554B0FF1"><enum>(b)</enum><header display-inline="yes-display-inline">Definitions</header><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">Section 3 of the Congressional Budget and
			 Impoundment Control Act of 1974 is amended by adding at the end the following
			 new paragraph:</text>
					<quoted-block display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD81D90AB2DEA466C856D4D7D73741648" style="OLC">
						<paragraph commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF083857B7AD44D7EA56B538782A34731"><enum>(11)</enum><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">The terms <quote>emergency</quote> and
				<quote>unanticipated</quote> have the meanings given to such terms in section
				250(c) of the Balanced Budget and Emergency Deficit Control Act of
				1985.</text>
						</paragraph><after-quoted-block>.</after-quoted-block></quoted-block>
				</subsection><subsection commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD9FC592CAEB54869A8AA00E0DC7FBC63"><enum>(c)</enum><header display-inline="yes-display-inline">Appeals for discretionary
			 caps</header><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">Section 904(c)(2) of the
			 Congressional Budget Act of 1974 is amended by striking <quote>and
			 312(c)</quote> and inserting <quote>312(c), and 314(e)</quote>.</text>
				</subsection></section><section commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H5D7B11C08BBC4AB4B62FF697220E66BD" section-type="subsequent-section"><enum>106.</enum><header display-inline="yes-display-inline">Senate budget enforcement</header>
				<subsection commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA8E9885088D8433C8AB6BE5A99E4C543"><enum>(a)</enum><header display-inline="yes-display-inline">In general</header>
					<paragraph commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HEBF6F4BC342B42D289C5CB71DAD8ADF5"><enum>(1)</enum><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">For the purpose of enforcing the
			 Congressional Budget Act of 1974 through April 15, 2012, including section 300
			 of that Act, and enforcing budgetary points of order in prior concurrent
			 resolutions on the budget, the allocations, aggregates, and levels set in
			 subsection (b)(1) shall apply in the Senate in the same manner as for a
			 concurrent resolution on the budget for fiscal year 2012 with appropriate
			 budgetary levels for fiscal years 2011 and 2013 through 2021.</text>
					</paragraph><paragraph commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HFBC87C45242A4B25B332C0501711CCE0"><enum>(2)</enum><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">For the purpose of enforcing the
			 Congressional Budget Act of 1974 after April 15, 2012, including section 300 of
			 that Act, and enforcing budgetary points of order in prior concurrent
			 resolutions on the budget, the allocations, aggregates, and levels set in
			 subsection (b)(2) shall apply in the Senate in the same manner as for a
			 concurrent resolution on the budget for fiscal year 2013 with appropriate
			 budgetary levels for fiscal years 2012 and 2014 through 2022.</text>
					</paragraph></subsection><subsection commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H0421837EFCBE4448AE54521F4355A212"><enum>(b)</enum><header display-inline="yes-display-inline">Committee allocations, aggregates, and
			 levels</header>
					<paragraph commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HFB897EE029AB4CCD91A2ABED45A57E83"><enum>(1)</enum><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">As soon as practicable after the date of
			 enactment of this section, the Chairman of the Committee on the Budget shall
			 file—</text>
						<subparagraph commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H39D40A8C86C744BA96D7DCFF57CD64FF"><enum>(A)</enum><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">for the Committee on Appropriations,
			 committee allocations for fiscal years 2011 and 2012 consistent with the
			 discretionary spending limits set forth in this Act for the purpose of
			 enforcing section 302 of the Congressional Budget Act of 1974;</text>
						</subparagraph><subparagraph commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H3C586007FC1F4275A3C5663072AE99A7"><enum>(B)</enum><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">for all committees other than the Committee
			 on Appropriations, committee allocations for fiscal years 2011, 2012, 2012
			 through 2016, and 2012 through 2021 consistent with the Congressional Budget
			 Office’s March 2011 baseline adjusted to account for the budgetary effects of
			 this Act and legislation enacted prior to this Act but not included in the
			 Congressional Budget Office’s March 2011 baseline, for the purpose of enforcing
			 section 302 of the Congressional Budget Act of 1974;</text>
						</subparagraph><subparagraph commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE810638BB35C484589E8AB35DCFE295D"><enum>(C)</enum><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">aggregate spending levels for fiscal years
			 2011 and 2012 and aggregate revenue levels for fiscal years 2011, 2012, 2012
			 through 2016, 2012 through 2021 consistent with the Congressional Budget
			 Office’s March 2011 baseline adjusted to account for the budgetary effects of
			 this Act and legislation enacted prior to this Act but not included in the
			 Congressional Budget Office’s March 2011 baseline, and the discretionary
			 spending limits set forth in this Act for the purpose of enforcing section 311
			 of the Congressional Budget Act of 1974; and</text>
						</subparagraph><subparagraph commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H6C958D10039C468A9A5B64863988FFFF"><enum>(D)</enum><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">levels of Social Security revenues and
			 outlays for fiscal years 2011, 2012, 2012 through 2016, and 2012 through 2021
			 consistent with the Congressional Budget Office’s March 2011 baseline adjusted
			 to account for the budgetary effects of this Act and legislation enacted prior
			 to this Act but not included in the Congressional Budget Office’s March 2011
			 baseline, for the purpose of enforcing sections 302 and 311 of the
			 Congressional Budget Act of 1974.</text>
						</subparagraph></paragraph><paragraph commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HFBC536CF09474F10BB773BDADA375600"><enum>(2)</enum><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">Not later than April 15, 2012, the Chairman
			 of the Committee on the Budget shall file—</text>
						<subparagraph commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA48DE640F1C44C1FAC4F5F524634CEAB"><enum>(A)</enum><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">for the Committee on Appropriations,
			 committee allocations for fiscal years 2012 and 2013 consistent with the
			 discretionary spending limits set forth in this Act for the purpose of
			 enforcing section 302 of the Congressional Budget Act of 1974;</text>
						</subparagraph><subparagraph commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H5E82F610C2F24B349132182E4F7B19B2"><enum>(B)</enum><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">for all committees other than the Committee
			 on Appropriations, committee allocations for fiscal years 2012, 2013, 2013
			 through 2017, and 2013 through 2022 consistent with the Congressional Budget
			 Office’s March 2012 baseline for the purpose of enforcing section 302 of the
			 Congressional Budget Act of 1974;</text>
						</subparagraph><subparagraph commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H2699F0D58D094890A4BD4A2FE31DC0D5"><enum>(C)</enum><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">aggregate spending levels for fiscal years
			 2012 and 2013 and aggregate revenue levels for fiscal years 2012, 2013,
			 2013–2017, and 2013–2022 consistent with the Congressional Budget Office’s
			 March 2012 baseline and the discretionary spending limits set forth in this Act
			 for the purpose of enforcing section 311 of the Congressional Budget Act of
			 1974; and</text>
						</subparagraph><subparagraph commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H8C734EC3E06B42538C06D8794840FB5F"><enum>(D)</enum><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">levels of Social Security revenues and
			 outlays for fiscal years 2012 and 2013, 2013–2017, and 2013–2022 consistent
			 with the Congressional Budget Office’s March 2012 baseline budget for the
			 purpose of enforcing sections 302 and 311 of the Congressional Budget Act of
			 1974.</text>
						</subparagraph></paragraph></subsection><subsection commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H81E4ADABF064412E85E2730D0F509D18"><enum>(c)</enum><header display-inline="yes-display-inline">Senate pay-as-you-go scorecard</header>
					<paragraph commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H7A3BA06047894501A45A750D0859F793"><enum>(1)</enum><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">Effective on the date of enactment of this
			 section, for the purpose of enforcing section 201 of S. Con. Res. 21 (110th
			 Congress), the Chairman of the Senate Committee on the Budget shall reduce any
			 balances of direct spending and revenues for any fiscal year to 0
			 (zero).</text>
					</paragraph><paragraph commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF03913C32B73498F854CB2DAC3AAFE55"><enum>(2)</enum><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">Not later than April 15, 2012, for the
			 purpose of enforcing section 201 of S. Con. Res. 21 (110th Congress), the
			 Chairman of the Senate Committee on the Budget shall reduce any balances of
			 direct spending and revenues for any fiscal year to 0 (zero).</text>
					</paragraph><paragraph commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H4D4F4D26A73040748FD141A5DEC0EDFC"><enum>(3)</enum><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">Upon resetting the Senate paygo scorecard
			 pursuant to paragraph (2), the Chairman shall publish a notification of such
			 action in the Congressional Record.</text>
					</paragraph></subsection><subsection commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H48DADF7B038E4C0C8D81ADAA7DE0FD07"><enum>(d)</enum><header display-inline="yes-display-inline">Further adjustments</header>
					<paragraph commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD660413ED97D43D381D94820F018655A"><enum>(1)</enum><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">The Chairman of the Committee on the Budget
			 of the Senate may revise any allocations, aggregates, or levels set pursuant to
			 this section to account for any subsequent adjustments to discretionary
			 spending limits made pursuant to this Act.</text>
					</paragraph><paragraph commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H3B129A5A102D4F5B9904C2C94D1BD36A"><enum>(2)</enum><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">With respect to any allocations,
			 aggregates, or levels set or adjustments made pursuant to this section,
			 sections 412 through 414 of S. Con. Res. 13 (111th Congress) shall remain in
			 effect.</text>
					</paragraph></subsection><subsection commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD3F7922B21DF4D72AE9143CA04AF3D36"><enum>(e)</enum><header display-inline="yes-display-inline">Expiration</header>
					<paragraph commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD760E38D193C4A6EA69BE10F4B44316D"><enum>(1)</enum><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">Subsections (a)(1), (b)(1), and (c)(1)
			 shall expire if a concurrent resolution on the budget for fiscal year 2012 is
			 agreed to by the Senate and House of Representatives pursuant to section 301 of
			 the Congressional Budget Act of 1974.</text>
					</paragraph><paragraph commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD6C619C073A444BBA652A885A4E42A54"><enum>(2)</enum><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">Subsections (a)(2), (b)(2), and (c)(2)
			 shall expire if a concurrent resolution on the budget for fiscal year 2013 is
			 agreed to by the Senate and House of Representatives pursuant to section 301 of
			 the Congressional Budget Act of 1974.</text>
					</paragraph></subsection></section></title><title commented="no" id="H19485766E5B54024B23642AA2F17C653" level-type="subsequent"><enum>II</enum><header display-inline="yes-display-inline">VOTE ON THE BALANCED BUDGET AMENDMENT
			 </header>
			<section commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H4DAD12EF33C8463DA711FE8A6919833B" section-type="subsequent-section"><enum>201.</enum><header display-inline="yes-display-inline">Vote on the balanced budget
			 amendment</header><text display-inline="no-display-inline">After September 30,
			 2011, and not later than December 31, 2011, the House of Representatives and
			 Senate, respectively, shall vote on passage of a joint resolution, the title of
			 which is as follows: <quote>Joint resolution proposing a balanced budget
			 amendment to the Constitution of the United States.</quote>.</text>
			</section><section commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE8C93B283FBF4DCB9B30734B7B0141C9" section-type="subsequent-section"><enum>202.</enum><header display-inline="yes-display-inline">Consideration by the other House</header>
				<subsection commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HAA3BB3FE4B4F46FEA91EF4E92AB27594"><enum>(a)</enum><header display-inline="yes-display-inline">House consideration</header>
					<paragraph commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H08087646AB314D0894236983E58559BC"><enum>(1)</enum><header display-inline="yes-display-inline">Referral</header><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">If the House receives a joint resolution
			 described in section 201 from the Senate, such joint resolution shall be
			 referred to the Committee on the Judiciary. If the committee fails to report
			 the joint resolution within five legislative days, it shall be in order to move
			 that the House discharge the committee from further consideration of the joint
			 resolution. Such a motion shall not be in order after the House has disposed of
			 a motion to discharge the joint resolution. The previous question shall be
			 considered as ordered on the motion to its adoption without intervening motion
			 except twenty minutes of debate equally divided and controlled by the proponent
			 and an opponent. If such a motion is adopted, the House shall proceed
			 immediately to consider the joint resolution in accordance with paragraph (3).
			 A motion to reconsider the vote by which the motion is disposed of shall not be
			 in order.</text>
					</paragraph><paragraph commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF53BE730D31545A98E384733F816ECAF"><enum>(2)</enum><header display-inline="yes-display-inline">Proceeding to consideration</header><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">After the joint resolution has been
			 referred to the appropriate calendar or the committee has been discharged
			 (other than by motion) from its consideration, it shall be in order to move to
			 proceed to consider the joint resolution in the House. Such a motion shall not
			 be in order after the House has disposed of a motion to proceed with respect to
			 the joint resolution. The previous question shall be considered as ordered on
			 the motion to its adoption without intervening motion. A motion to reconsider
			 the vote by which the motion is disposed of shall not be in order.</text>
					</paragraph><paragraph commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H5AD5892530EE4940B4F30D96A48B173E"><enum>(3)</enum><header display-inline="yes-display-inline">Consideration</header><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">The joint resolution shall be considered as
			 read. All points of order against the joint resolution and against its
			 consideration are waived. The previous question shall be considered as ordered
			 on the joint resolution to its passage without intervening motion except two
			 hours of debate equally divided and controlled by the proponent and an opponent
			 and one motion to limit debate on the joint resolution. A motion to reconsider
			 the vote on passage of the joint resolution shall not be in order.</text>
					</paragraph></subsection><subsection commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HCDA1E766612B402A8A0603ADBEB7779A"><enum>(b)</enum><header display-inline="yes-display-inline">Senate consideration</header><paragraph commented="no" display-inline="yes-display-inline" id="HE86631632E5A45589B80CF94413E21D3"><enum>(1)</enum><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">If the Senate receives a joint resolution
			 described in section 201 from the House of Representatives, such joint
			 resolution shall be referred to the appropriate committee of the Senate. If
			 such committee has not reported the joint resolution at the close of the fifth
			 session day after its receipt by the Senate, such committee shall be
			 automatically discharged from further consideration of the joint resolution and
			 it shall be placed on the appropriate calendar.</text>
					</paragraph><paragraph commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H598866DE5BB14DE39007723235E8482C" indent="up1"><enum>(2)</enum><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">Consideration of the joint resolution and
			 on all debatable motions and appeals in connection therewith, shall be limited
			 to not more than 20 hours, which shall be divided equally between the majority
			 and minority leaders or their designees. A motion further to limit debate is in
			 order and not debatable. An amendment to, or a motion to postpone, or a motion
			 to proceed to the consideration of other business, or a motion to recommit the
			 joint resolution is not in order. Any debatable motion or appeal is debatable
			 for not to exceed 1 hour, to be divided equally between those favoring and
			 those opposing the motion or appeal. All time used for consideration of the
			 joint resolution, including time used for quorum calls and voting, shall be
			 counted against the total 20 hours of consideration.</text>
					</paragraph><paragraph commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB33C0C0092E249F5A0B1593830871344" indent="up1"><enum>(3)</enum><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">If the Senate has voted to proceed to a
			 joint resolution, the vote on passage of the joint resolution shall be taken on
			 or before the close of the seventh session day after such joint resolution has
			 been reported or discharged or immediately following the conclusion of
			 consideration of the joint resolution, and a single quorum call at the
			 conclusion of the debate if requested in accordance with the rules of the
			 Senate.</text>
					</paragraph></subsection></section></title><title commented="no" id="HF1C25D4F4CAC47B09818B679D6D2ADDA" level-type="subsequent"><enum>III</enum><header display-inline="yes-display-inline">DEBT CEILING DISAPPROVAL PROCESS</header>
			<section commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H6344BFD676074558899D63B6BDB76C76" section-type="subsequent-section"><enum>301.</enum><header display-inline="yes-display-inline">Debt ceiling disapproval process</header>
				<subsection commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H965B7E7F6BDF446B8F78C8CD3FE371F1"><enum>(a)</enum><header display-inline="yes-display-inline">In general</header><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">Subchapter I of chapter 31 of subtitle III
			 of title 31, United States Code, is amended—</text>
					<paragraph commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H37C35041BCF04266B11428C26E001419"><enum>(1)</enum><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">in section 3101(b), by striking <quote>or
			 otherwise</quote> and inserting <quote>or as provided by section 3101A or
			 otherwise</quote>; and</text>
					</paragraph><paragraph commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HAEA3DB4366C54773A17FBABC36313C03"><enum>(2)</enum><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">by inserting after section 3101 the
			 following:</text>
						<quoted-block display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HDD779B7890904FBA9DE71164922CEB12" style="USC">
							<section commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H19D0A713C496413BBD93B698B9916B70" section-type="subsequent-section"><enum>3101A.</enum><header display-inline="yes-display-inline">Presidential modification of the debt
				ceiling</header>
								<subsection commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF586BF5B5E2E407A95EE76F3E12CFE54"><enum>(a)</enum><header display-inline="yes-display-inline">In general</header>
									<paragraph commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H829991E31CB14DEFB64C23AFA560CD84"><enum>(1)</enum><header display-inline="yes-display-inline">$900 billion</header>
										<subparagraph commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H3954BCCB2911465E99B853FFA0946B73"><enum>(A)</enum><header display-inline="yes-display-inline">Certification</header><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">If, not later than December 31, 2011, the
				President submits a written certification to Congress that the President has
				determined that the debt subject to limit is within $100,000,000,000 of the
				limit in section 3101(b) and that further borrowing is required to meet
				existing commitments, the Secretary of the Treasury may exercise authority to
				borrow an additional $900,000,000,000, subject to the enactment of a joint
				resolution of disapproval enacted pursuant to this section. Upon submission of
				such certification, the limit on debt provided in section 3101(b) (referred to
				in this section as the <quote>debt limit</quote>) is increased by
				$400,000,000,000.</text>
										</subparagraph><subparagraph commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB1C91F440F914182939C4F77BD8C4984"><enum>(B)</enum><header display-inline="yes-display-inline">Resolution of disapproval</header><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">Congress may consider a joint resolution of
				disapproval of the authority under subparagraph (A) as provided in subsections
				(b) through (f). The joint resolution of disapproval considered under this
				section shall contain only the language provided in subsection (b)(2). If the
				time for disapproval has lapsed without enactment of a joint resolution of
				disapproval under this section, the debt limit is increased by an additional
				$500,000,000,000.</text>
										</subparagraph></paragraph><paragraph commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H05317176681B400A945A023DFF85B3B9"><enum>(2)</enum><header display-inline="yes-display-inline">Additional amount</header>
										<subparagraph commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HBF25EDFD430E46D4A98EA6DC0E00BCFF"><enum>(A)</enum><header display-inline="yes-display-inline">Certification</header><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">If, after the debt limit is increased by
				$900,000,000,000 under paragraph (1), the President submits a written
				certification to Congress that the President has determined that the debt
				subject to limit is within $100,000,000,000 of the limit in section 3101(b) and
				that further borrowing is required to meet existing commitments, the Secretary
				of the Treasury may, subject to the enactment of a joint resolution of
				disapproval enacted pursuant to this section, exercise authority to borrow an
				additional amount equal to—</text>
											<clause commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H618388AB2B1A4C1F8C437C24C0C3908B"><enum>(i)</enum><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">$1,200,000,000,000, unless clause (ii) or
				(iii) applies;</text>
											</clause><clause commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H04A4A5294214486DA255DA3298D28BB1"><enum>(ii)</enum><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">$1,500,000,000,000 if the Archivist of the
				United States has submitted to the States for their ratification a proposed
				amendment to the Constitution of the United States pursuant to a joint
				resolution entitled ‘Joint resolution proposing a balanced budget amendment to
				the Constitution of the United States’; or</text>
											</clause><clause commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H9258E8C306F646A4A6B49024C8CB49D8"><enum>(iii)</enum><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">if a joint committee bill to achieve an
				amount greater than $1,200,000,000,000 in deficit reduction as provided in
				section 401(b)(3)(B)(i)(II) of the Budget Control Act of 2011 is enacted, an
				amount equal to the amount of that deficit reduction, but not greater than
				$1,500,000,000,000, unless clause (ii) applies.</text>
											</clause></subparagraph><subparagraph commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H9A1FECF56FA54AEC9F260FC0B4B28F67"><enum>(B)</enum><header display-inline="yes-display-inline">Resolution of disapproval</header><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">Congress may consider a joint resolution of
				disapproval of the authority under subparagraph (A) as provided in subsections
				(b) through (f). The joint resolution of disapproval considered under this
				section shall contain only the language provided in subsection (b)(2). If the
				time for disapproval has lapsed without enactment of a joint resolution of
				disapproval under this section, the debt limit is increased by the amount
				authorized under subparagraph (A).</text>
										</subparagraph></paragraph></subsection><subsection commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H3DE8DFC076004BA6B9988A2360A98500"><enum>(b)</enum><header display-inline="yes-display-inline">Joint resolution of disapproval</header>
									<paragraph commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H0600BD4F48974DC2B2D4A096CE222C1C"><enum>(1)</enum><header display-inline="yes-display-inline">In general</header><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">Except for the $400,000,000,000 increase in
				the debt limit provided by subsection (a)(1)(A), the debt limit may not be
				raised under this section if, within 50 calendar days after the date on which
				Congress receives a certification described in subsection (a)(1) or within 15
				calendar days after Congress receives the certification described in subsection
				(a)(2) (regardless of whether Congress is in session), there is enacted into
				law a joint resolution disapproving the President’s exercise of authority with
				respect to such additional amount.</text>
									</paragraph><paragraph commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE7DC8E8A97F041EB8447A5D646E08B2A"><enum>(2)</enum><header display-inline="yes-display-inline">Contents of joint resolution</header><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">For the purpose of this section, the term
				<quote>joint resolution</quote> means only a joint resolution—</text>
										<subparagraph commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H455DD2C0935E4B6A8EBBBF0411309044"><enum>(A)</enum><clause commented="no" display-inline="yes-display-inline" id="HF06ADA775DDE4735A0A3176E827A6EA3"><enum>(i)</enum><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">for the certification described in
				subsection (a)(1), that is introduced on September 6, 7, 8, or 9, 2011 (or, if
				the Senate was not in session, the next calendar day on which the Senate is in
				session); and</text>
											</clause><clause commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H7299994277BF4302A113338C33BF9DA0" indent="up1"><enum>(ii)</enum><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">for the certification described in
				subsection (a)(2), that is introduced between the date the certification is
				received and 3 calendar days after that date;</text>
											</clause></subparagraph><subparagraph commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD9DEEA0EC59C4CD29AC160F7FECCB843"><enum>(B)</enum><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">which does not have a preamble;</text>
										</subparagraph><subparagraph commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H352DD45E0AA04E29ADADB092C4E55CD0"><enum>(C)</enum><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">the title of which is only as follows:
				<quote>Joint resolution relating to the disapproval of the President’s exercise
				of authority to increase the debt limit, as submitted under section 3101A of
				title 31, United States Code, on ______</quote> (with the blank containing the
				date of such submission); and</text>
										</subparagraph><subparagraph commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HCF9BDAA5504A4E9E86E02B5B793EE734"><enum>(D)</enum><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">the matter after the resolving clause of
				which is only as follows: <quote>That Congress disapproves of the President’s
				exercise of authority to increase the debt limit, as exercised pursuant to the
				certification under <external-xref legal-doc="usc" parsable-cite="usc/31/3101A">section 3101A(a)</external-xref> of title 31, United States
				Code.</quote>.</text>
										</subparagraph></paragraph></subsection><subsection commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H9741FDE0D7324A1EA5BDE7A885C801DF"><enum>(c)</enum><header display-inline="yes-display-inline">Expedited consideration in house of
				representatives</header>
									<paragraph commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H197A06AA255E4085B5EA7A25561EB880"><enum>(1)</enum><header display-inline="yes-display-inline">Reconvening</header><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">Upon receipt of a certification described
				in subsection (a)(2), the Speaker, if the House would otherwise be adjourned,
				shall notify the Members of the House that, pursuant to this section, the House
				shall convene not later than the second calendar day after receipt of such
				certification.</text>
									</paragraph><paragraph commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H99F78ED3D4B2470D817AE0EC2E8EAD6B"><enum>(2)</enum><header display-inline="yes-display-inline">Reporting and discharge</header><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">Any committee of the House of
				Representatives to which a joint resolution is referred shall report it to the
				House without amendment not later than 5 calendar days after the date of
				introduction of a joint resolution described in subsection (a). If a committee
				fails to report the joint resolution within that period, the committee shall be
				discharged from further consideration of the joint resolution and the joint
				resolution shall be referred to the appropriate calendar.</text>
									</paragraph><paragraph commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H92C883085CD046D5A9D4B563FEB717FC"><enum>(3)</enum><header display-inline="yes-display-inline">Proceeding to consideration</header><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">After each committee authorized to consider
				a joint resolution reports it to the House or has been discharged from its
				consideration, it shall be in order, not later than the sixth day after
				introduction of a joint resolution under subsection (a), to move to proceed to
				consider the joint resolution in the House. All points of order against the
				motion are waived. Such a motion shall not be in order after the House has
				disposed of a motion to proceed on a joint resolution addressing a particular
				submission. The previous question shall be considered as ordered on the motion
				to its adoption without intervening motion. The motion shall not be debatable.
				A motion to reconsider the vote by which the motion is disposed of shall not be
				in order.</text>
									</paragraph><paragraph commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H4AB832049A2A4AE9A02A7E1F032A61E4"><enum>(4)</enum><header display-inline="yes-display-inline">Consideration</header><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">The joint resolution shall be considered as
				read. All points of order against the joint resolution and against its
				consideration are waived. The previous question shall be considered as ordered
				on the joint resolution to its passage without intervening motion except two
				hours of debate equally divided and controlled by the proponent and an
				opponent. A motion to reconsider the vote on passage of the joint resolution
				shall not be in order.</text>
									</paragraph></subsection><subsection commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H995B8A282B7040B5A32AF5D9FB5B4349"><enum>(d)</enum><header display-inline="yes-display-inline">Expedited procedure in senate</header>
									<paragraph commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H74BECBE2AED049C68F4D8049B7AF19B3"><enum>(1)</enum><header display-inline="yes-display-inline">Reconvening</header><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">Upon receipt of a certification under
				subsection (a)(2), if the Senate has adjourned or recessed for more than 2
				days, the majority leader of the Senate, after consultation with the minority
				leader of the Senate, shall notify the Members of the Senate that, pursuant to
				this section, the Senate shall convene not later than the second calendar day
				after receipt of such message.</text>
									</paragraph><paragraph commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB4985AE7BB0A456F869C6FF32495F543"><enum>(2)</enum><header display-inline="yes-display-inline">Placement on calendar</header><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">Upon introduction in the Senate, the joint
				resolution shall be immediately placed on the calendar.</text>
									</paragraph><paragraph commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF4FD89A989B0456093F2D2DF45C2CF4A"><enum>(3)</enum><header display-inline="yes-display-inline">Floor consideration</header>
										<subparagraph commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB947ED70B151497F999A12CB135651C2"><enum>(A)</enum><header display-inline="yes-display-inline">In general</header><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">Notwithstanding Rule XXII of the Standing
				Rules of the Senate, it is in order at any time during the period beginning on
				the day after the date on which Congress receives a certification under
				subsection (a) and, for the certification described in subsection (a)(1),
				ending on September 14, 2011, and for the certification described in subsection
				(a)(2), on the 6th day after the date on which Congress receives a
				certification under subsection (a) (even though a previous motion to the same
				effect has been disagreed to) to move to proceed to the consideration of the
				joint resolution, and all points of order against the joint resolution (and
				against consideration of the joint resolution) are waived. The motion to
				proceed is not debatable. The motion is not subject to a motion to postpone. A
				motion to reconsider the vote by which the motion is agreed to or disagreed to
				shall not be in order. If a motion to proceed to the consideration of the
				resolution is agreed to, the joint resolution shall remain the unfinished
				business until disposed of.</text>
										</subparagraph><subparagraph commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H31FC63CEEEC54982AA954F450CE3DE67"><enum>(B)</enum><header display-inline="yes-display-inline">Consideration</header><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">Consideration of the joint resolution, and
				on all debatable motions and appeals in connection therewith, shall be limited
				to not more than 10 hours, which shall be divided equally between the majority
				and minority leaders or their designees. A motion further to limit debate is in
				order and not debatable. An amendment to, or a motion to postpone, or a motion
				to proceed to the consideration of other business, or a motion to recommit the
				joint resolution is not in order.</text>
										</subparagraph><subparagraph commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H8BFE654086354BFA9EA77CA7736FD10D"><enum>(C)</enum><header display-inline="yes-display-inline">Vote on passage</header><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">If the Senate has voted to proceed to a
				joint resolution, the vote on passage of the joint resolution shall occur
				immediately following the conclusion of consideration of the joint resolution,
				and a single quorum call at the conclusion of the debate if requested in
				accordance with the rules of the Senate.</text>
										</subparagraph><subparagraph commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H6FB1F6DCE1A64EB59854EAB2C1C70F36"><enum>(D)</enum><header display-inline="yes-display-inline">Rulings of the chair on
				procedure</header><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">Appeals from the
				decisions of the Chair relating to the application of the rules of the Senate,
				as the case may be, to the procedure relating to a joint resolution shall be
				decided without debate.</text>
										</subparagraph></paragraph></subsection><subsection commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB98AD8C9170040C580D905229FF8766B"><enum>(e)</enum><header display-inline="yes-display-inline">Amendment not in order</header><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">A joint resolution of disapproval
				considered pursuant to this section shall not be subject to amendment in either
				the House of Representatives or the Senate.</text>
								</subsection><subsection commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H0E68E527F9834AD78766E06550D2F526"><enum>(f)</enum><header display-inline="yes-display-inline">Coordination with action by other
				house</header>
									<paragraph commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H097B8E0629034F95A13BCEF9112BC20D"><enum>(1)</enum><header display-inline="yes-display-inline">In general</header><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">If, before passing the joint resolution,
				one House receives from the other a joint resolution—</text>
										<subparagraph commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H995823F880FB4501A6E5B11FE70782FB"><enum>(A)</enum><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">the joint resolution of the other House
				shall not be referred to a committee; and</text>
										</subparagraph><subparagraph commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA4C522FAAC34471F84ED0D0C16579755"><enum>(B)</enum><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">the procedure in the receiving House shall
				be the same as if no joint resolution had been received from the other House
				until the vote on passage, when the joint resolution received from the other
				House shall supplant the joint resolution of the receiving House.</text>
										</subparagraph></paragraph><paragraph commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HADFC24A4B6E24A49A9E74A8C6B497364"><enum>(2)</enum><header display-inline="yes-display-inline">Treatment of joint resolution of other
				house</header><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">If the Senate fails to
				introduce or consider a joint resolution under this section, the joint
				resolution of the House shall be entitled to expedited floor procedures under
				this section.</text>
									</paragraph><paragraph commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H4AE22093FAD044DD8DCBE4D63E5EC9D4"><enum>(3)</enum><header display-inline="yes-display-inline">Treatment of companion
				measures</header><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">If, following
				passage of the joint resolution in the Senate, the Senate then receives the
				companion measure from the House of Representatives, the companion measure
				shall not be debatable.</text>
									</paragraph><paragraph commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H01586BFA05E14F3E9E17528C15071641"><enum>(4)</enum><header display-inline="yes-display-inline">Consideration after passage</header><subparagraph commented="no" display-inline="yes-display-inline" id="H378E16055278495BA6DEBCE2529DACD4"><enum>(A)</enum><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">If Congress passes a joint resolution, the
				period beginning on the date the President is presented with the joint
				resolution and ending on the date the President signs, allows to become law
				without his signature, or vetoes and returns the joint resolution (but
				excluding days when either House is not in session) shall be disregarded in
				computing the appropriate calendar day period described in subsection
				(b)(1).</text>
										</subparagraph><subparagraph commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF568FA0CC8994159A7641E8F24DE29A9" indent="up1"><enum>(B)</enum><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">Debate on a veto message in the Senate
				under this section shall be 1 hour equally divided between the majority and
				minority leaders or their designees.</text>
										</subparagraph></paragraph><paragraph commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H91FC4C7ED1F447508D3484A87139602F"><enum>(5)</enum><header display-inline="yes-display-inline">Veto override</header><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">If within the appropriate calendar day
				period described in subsection (b)(1), Congress overrides a veto of the joint
				resolution with respect to authority exercised pursuant to paragraph (1) or (2)
				of subsection (a), the limit on debt provided in section 3101(b) shall not be
				raised, except for the $400,000,000,000 increase in the limit provided by
				subsection (a)(1)(A).</text>
									</paragraph><paragraph commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA1E7FCF63829441D9321B34E9AC8FE97"><enum>(6)</enum><header display-inline="yes-display-inline">Sequestration</header><subparagraph commented="no" display-inline="yes-display-inline" id="H869BE434C31C40BAB937E3B81A830FD5"><enum>(A)</enum><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">If within the 50-calendar day period
				described in subsection (b)(1), the President signs the joint resolution, the
				President allows the joint resolution to become law without his signature, or
				Congress overrides a veto of the joint resolution with respect to authority
				exercised pursuant to paragraph (1) of subsection (a), there shall be a
				sequestration to reduce spending by $400,000,000,000. OMB shall implement the
				sequestration forthwith.</text>
										</subparagraph><subparagraph commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H4FC1B7A727C448EE898A9B15C5938A65" indent="up1"><enum>(B)</enum><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">OMB shall implement each half of such
				sequestration in accordance with section 255, section 256, and subsections (c),
				(d), (e), and (f) of section 253 of the Balanced Budget and Emergency Deficit
				Control Act of 1985, and for the purpose of such implementation the term
				<quote>excess deficit</quote> means the amount specified in subparagraph
				(A).</text>
										</subparagraph></paragraph></subsection><subsection commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H82265BAA7E3A45C5BA2133B9FA2A834B"><enum>(g)</enum><header display-inline="yes-display-inline">Rules of house of representatives and
				senate</header><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">This subsection and
				subsections (b), (c), (d), (e), and (f) (other than paragraph (6)) are enacted
				by Congress—</text>
									<paragraph commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HC7F4A5D919AF4249930E256521776A76"><enum>(1)</enum><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">as an exercise of the rulemaking power of
				the Senate and House of Representatives, respectively, and as such it is deemed
				a part of the rules of each House, respectively, but applicable only with
				respect to the procedure to be followed in that House in the case of a joint
				resolution, and it supersedes other rules only to the extent that it is
				inconsistent with such rules; and</text>
									</paragraph><paragraph commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA6F1B73EDA414BEA9584AE0410794038"><enum>(2)</enum><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">with full recognition of the constitutional
				right of either House to change the rules (so far as relating to the procedure
				of that House) at any time, in the same manner, and to the same extent as in
				the case of any other rule of that
				House.</text>
									</paragraph></subsection></section><after-quoted-block>.</after-quoted-block></quoted-block>
					</paragraph></subsection><subsection commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HED920E9470494086AE82E2238301AB5E"><enum>(b)</enum><header display-inline="yes-display-inline">Conforming amendment</header><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">The table of sections for chapter 31 of
			 title 31, United States Code, is amended by inserting after the item relating
			 to section 3101 the following new item:</text>
					<quoted-block display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H0C9CE6EE72A44CC7AD3216E979073852" style="USC">
						<toc regeneration="no-regeneration">
							<toc-entry bold="off" level="section">3101A. Presidential
				modification of the debt
				ceiling.</toc-entry>
						</toc>
						<after-quoted-block>.</after-quoted-block></quoted-block>
				</subsection></section><section commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HFDEA459682664B2DA7768B735041BB67" section-type="subsequent-section"><enum>302.</enum><header display-inline="yes-display-inline">Enforcement of budget goal</header>
				<subsection commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H15075B33DCFD491B821D81A12CFC703F"><enum>(a)</enum><header display-inline="yes-display-inline">In general</header><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">The Balanced Budget and Emergency Deficit
			 Control Act of 1985 is amended by inserting after section 251 the following new
			 section:</text>
					<quoted-block display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H680E01C5DDC7427CB2AF319C79DD18D3" style="OLC">
						<section commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H4BA71C945413453F8C6E3DA5869E79D4" section-type="subsequent-section"><enum>251A.</enum><header display-inline="yes-display-inline">Enforcement of budget goal</header><text display-inline="no-display-inline">Unless a joint committee bill achieving an
				amount greater than $1,200,000,000,000 in deficit reduction as provided in
				section 401(b)(3)(B)(i)(II) of the Budget Control Act of 2011 is enacted by
				January 15, 2012, the discretionary spending limits listed in section 251(c)
				shall be revised, and discretionary appropriations and direct spending shall be
				reduced, as follows:</text>
							<paragraph commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H519D8FC316A44F988D0DA0AD4CD4D432"><enum>(1)</enum><header display-inline="yes-display-inline">Revised security category; revised
				nonsecurity category</header><subparagraph commented="no" display-inline="yes-display-inline" id="HDAF23B22697648DE854E9BC8C56D51E6"><enum>(A)</enum><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">The term <quote>revised security
				category</quote> means discretionary appropriations in budget function
				050.</text>
								</subparagraph><subparagraph commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB53CA6D719E743BC9FB9E912E090B823" indent="up1"><enum>(B)</enum><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">The term <quote>revised nonsecurity
				category</quote> means discretionary appropriations other than in budget
				function 050.</text>
								</subparagraph></paragraph><paragraph commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H94437DB314064A83A80974D1DD25CF8A"><enum>(2)</enum><header display-inline="yes-display-inline">Revised discretionary spending
				limits</header><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">The discretionary
				spending limits for fiscal years 2013 through 2021 under section 251(c) shall
				be replaced with the following:</text>
								<subparagraph commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H8F80946AB3E349329662B557A34C713F"><enum>(A)</enum><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">For fiscal year 2013—</text>
									<clause commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HFF896C49B65E41E7BAC839EF610E8FAC"><enum>(i)</enum><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">for the security category, $546,000,000,000
				in budget authority; and</text>
									</clause><clause commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HC0A0F789337545099D68BD20AF02E31A"><enum>(ii)</enum><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">for the nonsecurity category,
				$501,000,000,000 in budget authority.</text>
									</clause></subparagraph><subparagraph commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H0760217BD7D14C47A996CD09E6EA649E"><enum>(B)</enum><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">For fiscal year 2014—</text>
									<clause commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H315C919897054896925F00B56257F947"><enum>(i)</enum><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">for the security category, $556,000,000,000
				in budget authority; and</text>
									</clause><clause commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HFC564CFB65FC4B8D95D8B54BA9644D8D"><enum>(ii)</enum><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">for the nonsecurity category,
				$510,000,000,000 in budget authority.</text>
									</clause></subparagraph><subparagraph commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H1DB87C8580B84BCA936CB201B4D28794"><enum>(C)</enum><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">For fiscal year 2015—</text>
									<clause commented="no" display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H4584F9B1AC07403BB63BE5ED6220604D"><enum>(i)</enum><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">for the security category, $566,000,000,000
				in budget authority; and</text>
