<section id="HE636E00CD9EF497793FBA3087D454DBA"><enum>1822.</enum> 
<subsection commented="no" display-inline="yes-display-inline" id="H9B03A00DEDEE4BED9D8305BAC33D8057"><enum>(a)</enum><text>Notwithstanding section 1101, the level for <quote>Department of Health and Human Services, Administration for Children and Families, Children and Families Services Programs</quote> shall be $9,538,433,000, of which: (1) $7,574,783,000 shall be for making payments under the Head Start Act; and (2) $703,000,000 shall be for making payments under the Community Services Block Grant (<quote>CSBG</quote>) Act, of which $23,350,000 shall be for sections 680 and 678E(b)(2), of which $18,000,000 shall be for section 680(a)(2), and not less than $5,000,000 shall be for section 680(a)(3)(B) of the CSBG Act.</text> </subsection> 
<subsection id="H640BDE25F6FE4011A7CB3937AD3B3140"><enum>(b)</enum><text>For purposes of allocating such funds under the Head Start Act, the term <term>base grant</term> as used in subsection (a)(7)(A) of section 640 of such Act with respect to funding provided to a Head Start agency (including each Early Head Start agency) for fiscal year 2010 shall be deemed to include 50 percent of the funds appropriated under <quote>Department of Health and Human Services, Administration for Children and Families, Children and Families Services Programs</quote> in <external-xref legal-doc="public-law" parsable-cite="pl/111/5">Public Law 111–5</external-xref> provided to such agency for carrying out expansion of Head Start programs, as that phrase is used in subsection (a)(4)(D) of such section 640, and provided to such agency as the ongoing funding level for operations in the 12 month budget period beginning in fiscal year 2010.</text> </subsection> 
<subsection id="HABE5D89A5D2F4ECAAC361F43CAD43865"><enum>(c)</enum><text>The fourteenth and fifteenth provisos under the heading <quote>Department of Health and Human Services, Administration for Children and Families, Children and Families Services Programs</quote> in division D of <external-xref legal-doc="public-law" parsable-cite="pl/111/117">Public Law 111–117</external-xref> shall not apply to funds appropriated by this division.</text> </subsection></section> 
<section id="H73828EC152EF4746AE9D4B7E64C3B7B3"><enum>1823.</enum> 
<subsection commented="no" display-inline="yes-display-inline" id="HE8551023C8DA41F8B2259D0C0E447E82"><enum>(a)</enum><text>Notwithstanding section 1101, the level for <quote>Department of Health and Human Services, Administration on Aging, Aging Services Programs</quote> shall be $1,500,323,000, of which $440,783,000 shall be for congregate nutrition, $217,676,000 shall be for home-delivered nutrition, and $27,708,000 shall be for Native American nutrition: <italic>Provided,</italic> That the total amount available for fiscal year 2011 under this and any other Act to carry out activities related to Aging and Disability Resource Centers under subsections (a)(20)(B)(iii) and (b)(8) of section 202 of the Older Americans Act shall not exceed the amount obligated for such purposes for fiscal year 2010 from funds available under <external-xref legal-doc="public-law" parsable-cite="pl/111/117">Public Law 111–117</external-xref>.</text> </subsection> 
<subsection id="HBAFD0343C1A643FBAABBAA7938040944"><enum>(b)</enum><text>The first proviso under the heading <quote>Department of Health and Human Services, Administration on Aging, Aging Services Programs</quote> in division D of <external-xref legal-doc="public-law" parsable-cite="pl/111/117">Public Law 111–117</external-xref> shall not apply to funds appropriated by this division.</text> </subsection> 
<subsection id="HED61BD158FD54931BA9CFFA1917C6703"><enum>(c)</enum><text>None of the funds appropriated by this division for <quote>Department of Health and Human Services, Administration on Aging, Aging Services Programs</quote> shall be used to carry out sections 1701 and 1703 of the PHS Act (with respect to chronic disease self-management activity grants), except that such funds may be used for necessary expenses associated with administering any such grants awarded prior to the date of the enactment of this division.</text> </subsection></section> 
<section id="H3814B71C95A748E28844CC73F91E35A3"><enum>1824.</enum><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">Notwithstanding section 1101, the level for <quote>Department of Health and Human Services, Office of the Secretary, General Departmental Management</quote> from the General Fund shall be $651,786,000: <italic>Provided,</italic> That amounts included under such heading in division D of <external-xref legal-doc="public-law" parsable-cite="pl/111/117">Public Law 111–117</external-xref> shall be applied to funds appropriated by this division by substituting <quote>$0</quote> for <quote>$5,789,000</quote>: <italic>Provided further,</italic> That the second and seventh provisos under such heading in division D of <external-xref legal-doc="public-law" parsable-cite="pl/111/117">Public Law 111–117</external-xref> shall not apply to funds appropriated by this division: <italic>Provided further,</italic> That none of the funds made available in this division shall be for carrying out activities specified under section 2003(b)(2) or (3) of the PHS Act: <italic>Provided further,</italic> That of the amount included under the heading <quote>Department of Health and Human Services, Office of the Secretary, General Departmental Management</quote> up to $175,905,000 may be transferred to other appropriation accounts within the Department of Health and Human Services to carry out the Secretary’s responsibilities: <italic>Provided further,</italic> That amounts included under such heading in division D of <external-xref legal-doc="public-law" parsable-cite="pl/111/117">Public Law 111–117</external-xref> shall be applied to funds appropriated by this division by substituting in the third proviso <quote>$105,000,000</quote> for <quote>$110,000,000</quote>.</text> </section> 
<section id="HEE38FB007E194EC6968E729959C9C28D"><enum>1825.</enum> 
<subsection commented="no" display-inline="yes-display-inline" id="H0B606DDE80F34611984D2F4E01BF7CBF"><enum>(a)</enum><text>Notwithstanding section 1101, the level for <quote>Department of Health and Human Services, Office of the Secretary, Public Health and Social Services Emergency Fund</quote> shall be $676,180,000, of which $65,578,000 shall be for expenses necessary to prepare for and respond to an influenza pandemic, none of which shall be available past September 30, 2011, and $35,000,000, to remain available until expended, shall be for expenses necessary for fit-out and other costs related to a competitive lease procurement to renovate or replace the existing headquarters building for Public Health Service agencies and other components of the Department of Health and Human Services: <italic>Provided,</italic> That in addition, $415,000,000 of the funds transferred to the account under the heading <quote>Department of Health and Human Services, Office of the Secretary, Public Health and Social Services Emergency Fund</quote> in <external-xref legal-doc="public-law" parsable-cite="pl/111/117">Public Law 111–117</external-xref> under the fourth paragraph under such heading may be used to support advanced research and development pursuant to section 319L of the PHS Act and other administrative expenses of the Biomedical Advanced Research and Development Authority: <italic>Provided further,</italic> That the first proviso in the first paragraph under such heading in division D of <external-xref legal-doc="public-law" parsable-cite="pl/111/117">Public Law 111–117</external-xref> and the language in such paragraph designating $10,000,000 to support delivery of medical countermeasures shall not apply to funds provided in this section: <italic>Provided further,</italic> That the fourth paragraph under such heading shall not apply to funds appropriated by this division.</text> </subsection> 
<subsection id="H513BA99E62A74CF5B8320A6F6A1F7B3A"><enum>(b)</enum><text>Of the amounts provided under the heading <quote>Department of Health and Human Services, Office of the Secretary, Public Health and Social Services Emergency Fund</quote> in Public Laws 111–8 and 111–117 and available for expenses necessary to prepare for and respond to an influenza pandemic, $170,000,000 may also be used—</text> 
<paragraph id="HDB5F872B5B1948CA8F1B9132E7F46F3C"><enum>(1)</enum><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">to plan, conduct, and support research to advance regulatory science to improve the ability to determine safety, effectiveness, quality, and performance of medical countermeasure products against chemical, biological, radiological, and nuclear agents including influenza virus; and</text> </paragraph> 
<paragraph id="H0728A150BC8346EAB82D190C8666F697"><enum>(2)</enum><text>to analyze, conduct, and improve regulatory review and compliance processes for such products.</text> </paragraph></subsection></section> 
<section id="H7B2F50B0418A47AB8361FA9CA0F0EBD7"><enum>1826.</enum><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">Of the funds made available for <quote>Department of Health and Human Services, Office of the Secretary, Public Health and Social Services Emergency Fund</quote> in <external-xref legal-doc="public-law" parsable-cite="pl/111/32">Public Law 111–32</external-xref>, $1,259,000,000 is rescinded, to be derived only from those amounts which have not yet been designated by the President as emergency funds.</text> </section> 
<section id="HE5585DE56E5B4A2B993CD202430A946E"><enum>1827.</enum><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">Hereafter, no funds appropriated by this division or by any previous or subsequent Act shall be subject to the allocation requirements of section 1707A(e) of the PHS Act.</text> </section> 
<section id="H10AE259ACF584054B11FF41ABC87C67D"><enum>1828.</enum><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">Hereafter, no funds appropriated by this division or by any previous or subsequent Act shall be available for transfer under section 274 of the PHS Act.</text> </section> 
<section id="H95DB4C77D60E4A52A66AF00F1BCA78EE"><enum>1829.</enum> 
<subsection commented="no" display-inline="yes-display-inline" id="H11E9D654D84F4EAAABEF24145A4F156D"><enum>(a)</enum><text>Notwithstanding section 1101, the level for <quote>Department of Education, Education for the Disadvantaged</quote> shall be $4,725,891,000, of which $4,628,056,000 shall become available on July 1, 2011, and remain available through September 30, 2012, for academic year 2011–2012: <italic>Provided,</italic> That not more than $8,167,000 shall be available to carry out sections 1501 and 1503 of the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 (<quote>ESEA</quote>).</text> </subsection> 
<subsection id="H08B6AA7832424F3E9999CC8CC15C42B2"><enum>(b)</enum><text>The seventh proviso under the heading <quote>Department of Education, Education for the Disadvantaged</quote> in division D of <external-xref legal-doc="public-law" parsable-cite="pl/111/117">Public Law 111–117</external-xref> shall be applied by substituting <quote>$535,633,000</quote> for <quote>$545,633,000</quote> and the tenth, eleventh and twelfth provisos shall not apply to funds appropriated by this division.</text> </subsection></section> 
<section id="H0EB70AE374224FC1ABBB1C0CE613C4FB"><enum>1830.</enum><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">For purposes of this division, the proviso under the heading <quote>Department of Education, Impact Aid</quote> in division D of <external-xref legal-doc="public-law" parsable-cite="pl/111/117">Public Law 111–117</external-xref> shall be applied by substituting <quote>2010–2011</quote> for <quote>2009–2010</quote>.</text> </section> 
<section id="H94A261970FDC434780A522A411AC7637"><enum>1831.</enum> 
<subsection commented="no" display-inline="yes-display-inline" id="HB82CB046AB174195ACE82E5A154C25DC"><enum>(a)</enum><text>Notwithstanding section 1101, the level for <quote>Department of Education, School Improvement Programs</quote> shall be $2,924,791,000, of which $2,754,244,000 shall become available on July 1, 2011, and remain available through September 30, 2012, for academic year 2011–2012: <italic>Provided,</italic> That of the amounts available for such heading: (1) no funds shall be available for activities authorized under part D of title II of the ESEA, or subpart 6 of part D of title V of the ESEA, or part Z of title VIII of the Higher Education Act of 1965; (2) $26,928,000 shall be available to carry out part D of title V of the ESEA; (3) for purposes of this section, up to $11,500,000 shall be available for activities described in the twelfth proviso under such heading in division D of <external-xref legal-doc="public-law" parsable-cite="pl/111/117">Public Law 111–117</external-xref>; (4) $380,732,000 shall be for State assessments authorized under section 6111 of the ESEA and $10,000,000 shall be for enhanced assessment instruments authorized under section 6112 of the ESEA; and (5) up to 1 percent of the funds for subpart 1 of part A of title II of the ESEA shall be reserved by the Secretary of Education for competitive awards for teacher training or professional enhancement activities to national not-for-profit organizations.</text> </subsection> 
<subsection id="H185BD8E660C44864A18204AB0F378F31"><enum>(b)</enum><text>The seventh proviso shall be applied by substituting <quote>$51,313,000</quote> for <quote>$56,313,000</quote> and the second, third, fifth, sixth, eighth and thirteenth provisos under the heading <quote>Department of Education, School Improvement Programs</quote> in division D of <external-xref legal-doc="public-law" parsable-cite="pl/111/117">Public Law 111–117</external-xref> shall not apply to funds appropriated by this division.</text> </subsection></section> 
<section id="HE4A81EBA3A1F419B97DE6192BA2B4B6D"><enum>1832.</enum> 
<subsection commented="no" display-inline="yes-display-inline" id="H61E6E132054F4871A4FFF9B34F61D920"><enum>(a)</enum><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">Notwithstanding section 1101, the level for <quote>Department of Education, Innovation and Improvement</quote> shall be $1,859,899,000, of which—</text> 
<paragraph id="H693EFEE206F3425F8EE5E43A0242A900"><enum>(1)</enum><text>$850,000,000 shall become available on the date of enactment of this division, and remain available through December 31, 2011, $440,982,000 shall be available to carry out part D of title V of the ESEA, and no funds shall be available for activities authorized under section 2151(c) of the ESEA, section 1504 of the ESEA, or part F of title VIII of the Higher Education Act of 1965; and</text></paragraph> 
<paragraph id="HEC698296DD6B4AA2B916A1425C817F25"><enum>(2)</enum><text>not more than $150,000,000 may be used to make awards under section 14007 of division A of <external-xref legal-doc="public-law" parsable-cite="pl/111/5">Public Law 111–5</external-xref> and not more than $700,000,000 may be used to make awards to States under section 14006 of division A of <external-xref legal-doc="public-law" parsable-cite="pl/111/5">Public Law 111–5</external-xref>, as amended by subsection (b) of this section: <italic>Provided,</italic> That none of such funds shall be made available prior to the submission of a detailed spending plan outlining the proposed competitions and priorities to the Committees on Appropriations of the House of Representatives and the Senate: <italic>Provided further,</italic> That awards may be made on the basis of previously submitted applications: <italic>Provided further,</italic> That the Secretary of Education shall administer grants for improving early childhood care and education jointly with the Secretary of Health and Human Services on such terms as such Secretaries set forth in an interagency agreement: <italic>Provided further,</italic> That the Secretary of Education shall be responsible for obligating and disbursing funds and ensuring compliance with applicable laws and administrative requirements with regard to such awards: <italic>Provided further,</italic> That the Secretary shall provide, on a timely and periodic basis, the findings from evaluations, including impact evaluations and interim progress evaluations, of activities conducted using funds previously obligated under sections 14006 and 14007 of division A of <external-xref legal-doc="public-law" parsable-cite="pl/111/5">Public Law 111–5</external-xref>, including Race to the Top and the Investing in Innovation Fund, to the Committees on Appropriations of the House of Representatives and the Senate.</text> </paragraph> </subsection> 
<subsection id="HBF4412892F24471280E430B4F243E23F"><enum>(b)</enum><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">Division A of <external-xref legal-doc="public-law" parsable-cite="pl/111/5">Public Law 111–5</external-xref>, as amended, is further amended—</text>

<section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H3D4D6FE5BB454329ACA46E8CF35EF7EB" section-type="subsequent-section"><enum>1856.</enum><header>GAO reports and audits on PPACA implementation and comparative effectiveness research funding and medicare actuarial analysis of impact of certain PPACA insurance changes on premiums</header> 
<subsection commented="no" display-inline="yes-display-inline" id="HB493FA9A5B0E4BC3A85823227821726F"><enum>(a)</enum><header>GAO report on PPACA implementation</header><text>Not later than 90 days after the date of the enactment of this Act, the Comptroller General of the United States shall submit to Congress a report on the costs and processes of implementing PPACA. Such report shall include the following (as of the date of preparation of the report):</text> 
<paragraph id="HF3052B8BA53E4AB9ACAC023161AE4377"><enum>(1)</enum><text>A list of the contracts, including the name of the contractors, their general areas of expertise, and the amount of money expended on each such contract, entered into by the Department of Health and Human Services and other Federal departments and agencies to provide services related to authority under PPACA that was not previously authorized.</text> </paragraph> 
<paragraph id="H1573F37BC4F440E993C97ECBC7369849"><enum>(2)</enum><text>A list of any firms hired by such a Department or agency to facilitate contracting with such contractors.</text> </paragraph> 
<paragraph id="H0282C8ABDE7C491D8789D1CFFF63184B"><enum>(3)</enum><text>A list of consultants who have been hired by such a Department or agency to assist in implementing PPACA, including their areas of expertise and the total cost for such consultants.</text> </paragraph></subsection> 
<subsection id="H9FB2E0D5C34E41BBA79C72E2AEB8B633"><enum>(b)</enum><header>GAO audit of annual limit waiver requests</header><text>Not later than 60 days after the date of the enactment of this Act, the Comptroller General shall submit to Congress a report that includes the results of an audit of requests for administrative waiver of the annual limit requirements of section 2711(a) of the Public Health Service Act (as inserted by section 1001(5) of the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act). Such report shall include an analysis of the number of approvals and denials of such requests and the reasons for such approval or denial.</text> </subsection> 
<subsection id="H131867752E4E49FAA5C2EA44D4ED77C0"><enum>(c)</enum><header>Medicare actuarial analysis of projected premium impacts of applying certain requirements</header><text>Not later than 90 days after the date of the enactment of this Act, the Chief Actuary of the Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services shall submit to Congress a report that contains an estimate of the impact of the guaranteed issue, guaranteed renewal, and community rating requirements under sections 2701 through 2703 of the Public Health Service Act, as inserted by section 1201 of the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act, on premiums for individuals and families with employer-sponsored health insurance. Such estimate shall cover the 10-year period beginning with 2014 and shall include an estimate of the number of such individuals and families who will experience a premium increase as a result of such requirements and the number of such individuals and families who will experience a premium decrease as a result of such requirements.</text> </subsection> 
<subsection id="HB8C2FD72D9264682B4D37173B4E61E10"><enum>(d)</enum><header>GAO audit of comparative effectiveness research funding</header><text>Not later than 60 days after the date of the enactment of this Act, the Comptroller General shall submit to Congress a report that includes the results of an audit of expenditures made for comparative effectiveness research through funds provided to the Agency for Healthcare Research and Quality, the National Institutes of Health, or any other agency within the Department of Health and Human Services under title VIII of the American Recovery and Reinvestment Act of 2009 (<external-xref legal-doc="public-law" parsable-cite="pl/111/5">Public Law 111–5</external-xref>) or under PPACA. Such report shall include a description of the expenditures made, the entities who received such funding, and the purpose of the funding.</text> </subsection> 
<subsection id="H77CD36AB45894744B6DEF2AA1CB9D06D"><enum>(e)</enum><header>PPACA defined</header><text>In this section, the term <term>PPACA</term> means the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (<external-xref legal-doc="public-law" parsable-cite="pl/111/148">Public Law 111–148</external-xref>) and includes the amendments made by such Act, title I and subtitle B of title II of the Health Care and Education Reconciliation Act of 2010 (<external-xref legal-doc="public-law" parsable-cite="pl/111/152">Public Law 111–152</external-xref>), and the amendments made by such title and subtitle.</text> </subsection></section>

<section id="H8BA110FCC0F041BB80C704A20B066393"><enum>2119.</enum> 
<subsection commented="no" display-inline="yes-display-inline" id="HA86D867C42EE4712BEBA7CC1069050CD"><enum>(a)</enum><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">Notwithstanding section 653(b) of the Foreign Assistance Act of 1961 (<external-xref legal-doc="usc" parsable-cite="usc/22/2413">22 U.S.C. 2413(b)</external-xref>), the President shall transmit the report required under section 653(a) of that Act with respect to the provision of funds appropriated or otherwise made available by this division for the Department of State, foreign operations, and related programs: <italic>Provided</italic>, That such report shall include a comparison of amounts, by category of assistance, provided or intended to be provided from funds appropriated for fiscal years 2010 and 2011, for each foreign country and international organization.</text> </subsection> 
<subsection id="HDA954D869AE742E599CA4B287FB87536"><enum>(b)</enum><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">Not later than 30 days after the date of enactment of this Act, each department, agency or organization funded by this title or by division F of <external-xref legal-doc="public-law" parsable-cite="pl/111/117">Public Law 111–117</external-xref> shall submit to the Committees on Appropriations an operating plan for such funds that provides details at the program, project, and activity level: <italic>Provided</italic>, That the report required under subsection (a) shall be considered to have met the requirements of this subsection with respect to funds made available to carry out the Foreign Assistance Act of 1961 and the Arms Export Control Act: <italic>Provided further</italic>, That the spending reports required in division F of <external-xref legal-doc="public-law" parsable-cite="pl/111/117">Public Law 111–117</external-xref> for assistance for Afghanistan, Pakistan, Iraq, the Caribbean Basin, Lebanon, Mexico, and Central America, and spending reports required for funds appropriated under the headings <quote>Diplomatic and Consular Programs</quote>, <quote>Embassy Security, Construction, and Maintenance</quote>, <quote>International Narcotics Control and Law Enforcement</quote>, <quote>Civilian Stabilization Initiative</quote>, and <quote>Peace Corps</quote> shall be considered to have met the requirements of this subsection.</text> </subsection> 
<subsection id="HF03F51F89D0747AE8FCEEA20E50B9E60"><enum>(c)</enum><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">The reports required under subsection (b) shall not be considered as meeting the notification requirements under section 7015 of division F of <external-xref legal-doc="public-law" parsable-cite="pl/111/117">Public Law 111–117</external-xref> or under section 634A of the Foreign Assistance Act of 1961.</text> </subsection> 
<subsection id="HA600302586DC4878B97C9A2D2A6B7440"><enum>(d)</enum><text>The Secretary of State shall consult with the Committees on Appropriations prior to implementing the rescissions made pursuant to section 2118 of this division, other than rescissions made pursuant to subsection (a) of such section.</text> </subsection></section>

<subsection commented="no" display-inline="yes-display-inline" id="H21EA534383C74DE38D595E63D2D8B3C2"><enum>(a)</enum><text>Notwithstanding section 1101, the amounts included under the heading <quote>Administration of Foreign Affairs, Office of Inspector General</quote> in division F of <external-xref legal-doc="public-law" parsable-cite="pl/111/117">Public Law 111–117</external-xref> shall be applied to funds appropriated by this division by substituting <quote>$22,000,000</quote> for <quote>$23,000,000</quote> for the Special Inspector General for Iraq Reconstruction, and <quote>$24,000,000</quote> for <quote>$23,000,000</quote> for the Special Inspector General for Afghanistan Reconstruction.</text> </subsection> 
<subsection id="H35A41588E4E4454EA2902324CC87CDE1"><enum>(b)</enum><text>The tenth proviso under the heading <quote>Economic Support Fund</quote> in division F of <external-xref legal-doc="public-law" parsable-cite="pl/111/117">Public Law 111–117</external-xref> shall be applied to funds appropriated by this division by substituting the following: <quote><italic>Provided further</italic>, That funds appropriated or otherwise made available by this division for assistance for Afghanistan and Pakistan may not be made available for direct government-to-government assistance unless the Secretary of State certifies to the Committees on Appropriations that the relevant implementing agency has been assessed and considered qualified to manage such funds and the Government of the United States and the government of the recipient country have agreed, in writing, to clear and achievable goals and objectives for the use of such funds, and have established mechanisms within each implementing agency to ensure that such funds are used for the purposes for which they were intended:</quote>.</text> </subsection> 
<subsection id="HE361FD85136E45348C6453B2A8B12867"><enum>(c)</enum><text>The second proviso under the heading <quote>International Security Assistance, Department of State, Peacekeeping Operations</quote> in division F of <external-xref legal-doc="public-law" parsable-cite="pl/111/117">Public Law 111–117</external-xref> shall be applied by substituting the following: <quote><italic>Provided further</italic>, That up to $55,918,000 may be used to pay assessed expenses of international peacekeeping activities in Somalia, except that up to an additional $35,000,000 may be made available for such purpose subject to prior consultation with, and the regular notification procedures of, the Committees on Appropriations:</quote>.</text> </subsection> 
<subsection id="H20390A68B92A4E62A39A342B68500D03"><enum>(d)</enum><text>Section 7004 of division F of <external-xref legal-doc="public-law" parsable-cite="pl/111/117">Public Law 111–117</external-xref> shall be applied to funds appropriated by this division by adding at the end the following new subsection:</text> 
<quoted-block display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HC9C05801298D48199836A5F05AFEAE2E" style="appropriations"> 
<subsection id="H371E75DDB66D43B8B50EB285CBCDBB8F"><enum>(d)</enum><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">For the purposes of calculating the fiscal year 2011 costs of providing new United States diplomatic facilities in accordance with section 604(e) of the Secure Embassy Construction and Counterterrorism Act of 1999 (<external-xref legal-doc="usc" parsable-cite="usc/22/4865">22 U.S.C. 4865</external-xref> note), the Secretary of State, in consultation with the Director of the Office of Management and Budget, shall determine the annual program level and agency shares in a manner that is proportional to the Department of State’s contribution for this purpose.</text> </subsection><after-quoted-block>.</after-quoted-block></quoted-block> </subsection> 
<subsection id="H7A35FE9BF11B4BAE97236D3A7AD8CAD1"><enum>(e)</enum><text>The second proviso in the second paragraph under the heading <quote>International Security Assistance, Funds Appropriated to the President, Foreign Military Financing Program</quote> in division F of <external-xref legal-doc="public-law" parsable-cite="pl/111/117">Public Law 111–117</external-xref> shall be applied to funds appropriated by this division by inserting <quote>Bahrain, Yemen,</quote> after <quote>Nepal,</quote>.</text> </subsection> 
<subsection id="HFDB54E003B1F4484B4546B49DC116EF9"><enum>(f)</enum><text>Section 7034(n) of division F of <external-xref legal-doc="public-law" parsable-cite="pl/111/117">Public Law 111–117</external-xref> shall be applied to funds appropriated by this division by adding at the end before the period the following: <quote>: <italic>Provided</italic>, That none of the funds appropriated or otherwise made available by this division or any other Act making appropriations for the Department of State, foreign operations, and related programs may be used to implement phase 3 of such authority</quote>.</text> </subsection> 
<subsection id="H6E2AA3F5D4664ECD8D2AD302F378F1D4"><enum>(g)</enum><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">Section 7034(m) of division F of <external-xref legal-doc="public-law" parsable-cite="pl/111/117">Public Law 111–117</external-xref> shall be applied to funds appropriated by this division by—</text> 
<paragraph id="HD1A80AF40E234C30A0E64DA3665B474C"><enum>(1)</enum><text>substituting “not less than $20,000,000” for “$30,000,000” in paragraph (5); and</text> </paragraph> 
<paragraph id="HB69B4C639E0848D6922F7CDED0CF94D4"><enum>(2)</enum><text>adding the following new paragraph at the end:</text> 
<quoted-block display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H745AC7434A2E49CAAB8FB82744CC0E9F" style="appropriations"> 
<paragraph id="H809D369A818D4AD1B396FE75A484098F"><enum>(6)</enum><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">The level otherwise provided by this Act for <quote>Related Agency, Broadcasting Board of Governors, International Broadcasting Operations</quote> is hereby increased by $10,000,000, to remain available until September 30, 2012, to expand unrestricted access to information on the Internet.</text> </paragraph><after-quoted-block>.</after-quoted-block></quoted-block> </paragraph></subsection> 
<subsection id="H9CEDAF9CD4F44F2C82D29F02B0950493"><enum>(h)</enum><text>Section 7042 of division F of <external-xref legal-doc="public-law" parsable-cite="pl/111/117">Public Law 111–117</external-xref> shall be applied to funds appropriated by this division by substituting the following for the proviso in subsection (d)(2): <quote>: <italic>Provided</italic>, That funds may not be made available for obligation until the Secretary of State determines and reports to the Committees on Appropriations that such funds to be provided are in the national security interest of the United States and provides the Committees on Appropriations a detailed spending plan</quote>.</text> </subsection> 
<subsection id="H68E604C25E804FF09C74ABFDA473AE87"><enum>(i)</enum><text>Section 7043 of division F of <external-xref legal-doc="public-law" parsable-cite="pl/111/117">Public Law 111–117</external-xref> shall be applied to funds appropriated by this division by substituting the following for subsection (b):</text> 
<quoted-block display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HAFE12C3D9BB54074896270379B793923" style="appropriations"> 
<subsection id="H61DC27FC90C44A6E9053DBBCC6EEA2E5"><enum>(b)</enum><header>Limitation</header><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">None of the funds appropriated or otherwise made available in this Act under the heading <quote>Export-Import Bank of the United States</quote> may be used by the Export-Import Bank of the United States to provide any new financing (including loans, guarantees, other credits, insurance, and reinsurance) to any person that is subject to sanctions under paragraph (2) or (3) of section 5(a) of the Iran Sanctions Act of 1996 (<external-xref legal-doc="public-law" parsable-cite="pl/104/172">Public Law 104–172</external-xref>).</text> </subsection><after-quoted-block>.</after-quoted-block></quoted-block> </subsection> 
<subsection id="HAD6AAC15222B4D879C1ABC85C750A354"><enum>(j)</enum><text>For purposes of the amount made available by this division for <quote>Export and Investment Assistance, Export-Import Bank of the United States, Administrative Expenses</quote>, project specific transaction costs, including direct and indirect costs incurred in claims settlements, and other costs for systems infrastructure directly supporting transactions, shall not be considered administrative expenses: <italic>Provided</italic>, That the Export-Import Bank of the United States may expend not more than $5,000,000 in fiscal year 2011 for such transaction costs.</text> </subsection> 
<subsection id="HFC9EA502898842E592D61C7DE4C79C8D"><enum>(k)</enum><text>The first proviso under the heading <quote>Department of the Treasury, Debt Restructuring</quote> in division F of <external-xref legal-doc="public-law" parsable-cite="pl/111/117">Public Law 111–117</external-xref> shall be applied to funds appropriated by this division by substituting <quote>should</quote> for <quote>shall</quote>.</text> </subsection> 
<subsection id="H4F875EE35BD94426940C070509CB9FE9"><enum>(l)</enum><text>Section 7059 of division F of <external-xref legal-doc="public-law" parsable-cite="pl/111/117">Public Law 111–117</external-xref> shall be applied to funds appropriated by this division by substituting—</text> 
<paragraph id="H9A455267A16D4A0284AD8B521258F777"><enum>(1)</enum><text><quote>should</quote> for <quote>may</quote> in subsection (c); and</text> </paragraph> 
<paragraph id="H31A703ADCE5D4078ADA8AED3AFCA6818"><enum>(2)</enum><text><quote>65</quote> for <quote>30</quote> the first place it appears in subsection (l).</text> </paragraph></subsection> 
<subsection id="H74937D4ED51E41C49B88DDBED5FB8479"><enum>(m)</enum><text>The Foreign Operations, Export Financing, and Related Programs Appropriations Act, 1990 (<external-xref legal-doc="public-law" parsable-cite="pl/101/167">Public Law 101–167</external-xref>) is amended—</text> 
<paragraph id="H6E3087A1FE7C444C942803335AA0D099"><enum>(1)</enum><text>in section 599D (<external-xref legal-doc="usc" parsable-cite="usc/8/1157">8 U.S.C. 1157</external-xref> note)—</text> 
<subparagraph id="H295A1BA0538747E0AF14CE23B2C22F45"><enum>(A)</enum><text>in subsection (b)(3), by striking <quote>and 2010</quote> and inserting <quote>2010, and 2011</quote>; and</text> </subparagraph> 
<subparagraph id="HD23852A7DEF6409F9928EFAEB1CB8B5D"><enum>(B)</enum><text>in subsection (e), by striking <quote>October 1, 2010</quote> each place it appears and inserting <quote>June 1, 2011</quote>; and</text> </subparagraph></paragraph> 
<paragraph id="HE9350650A81B4C2789DC719591D0D1A4"><enum>(2)</enum><text>in section 599E (<external-xref legal-doc="usc" parsable-cite="usc/8/1255">8 U.S.C. 1255</external-xref> note) in subsection (b)(2), by striking <quote>2010</quote> and inserting <quote>2011</quote>.</text> </paragraph></subsection></section> 
<section id="HCA7B7E317E5F4B1B9F5F1C22960AC070"><enum>2122.</enum> 
<subsection commented="no" display-inline="yes-display-inline" id="HFA3B07EC674849BFBC12955D363C4E3A"><enum>(a)</enum><header>In General</header><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">Subsections (b) through (d) of this section shall apply to funds appropriated by this division in lieu of section 7076 of division F of <external-xref legal-doc="public-law" parsable-cite="pl/111/117">Public Law 111–117</external-xref>.</text> </subsection> 
<subsection id="H2CAFD304DAE24E9EA211772BE57D400D"><enum>(b)</enum><header>Limitation</header><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">None of the funds appropriated or otherwise made available by this division under the headings <quote>Economic Support Fund</quote> and <quote>International Narcotics Control and Law Enforcement</quote> may be obligated for assistance for the Government of Afghanistan until the Secretary of State, in consultation with the Administrator of the United States Agency for International Development (USAID), certifies and reports to the Committees on Appropriations the following:</text> 
<paragraph id="H65853F68DD20407DBB41F845AC975507"><enum>(1)</enum><text>The Government of Afghanistan is—</text> 
<subparagraph id="H5C3813303E034AE6AA5CAEDB9B4E7FAE"><enum>(A)</enum><text>demonstrating a commitment to reduce corruption and improve governance, including by investigating, prosecuting, and sanctioning or removing corrupt officials from office and to implement financial transparency and accountability measures for government institutions and officials (including the Central Bank);</text> </subparagraph> 
<subparagraph id="H8E412C0CCF814B0C8BD97A98DD7A8DE3"><enum>(B)</enum><text>taking significant steps to facilitate active public participation in governance and oversight; and</text> </subparagraph> 
<subparagraph id="HCE5486245A6C49768B310FAD7D6E1E59"><enum>(C)</enum><text>taking credible steps to protect the internationally recognized human rights of Afghan women.</text> </subparagraph></paragraph> 
<paragraph id="H8BAA3AA1371B43BABD919DBB1B2E2287"><enum>(2)</enum><text>There is a unified United States Government anti-corruption strategy for Afghanistan.</text> </paragraph> 
<paragraph id="HDF31F47F617143EDB15E15B181D425EC"><enum>(3)</enum><text>Funds will be programmed to support and strengthen the capacity of Afghan public and private institutions and entities to reduce corruption and to improve transparency and accountability of national, provincial, and local governments, as outlined in the spending plan submitted to the Committees on Appropriations on October 26, 2010 (CN 10–298).</text> </paragraph> 
<paragraph id="HE060272C140F4D288C8F8C070CB67399"><enum>(4)</enum><text>Representatives of Afghan national, provincial, or local governments, local communities, and civil society organizations, as appropriate, will be consulted and participate in the design of programs, projects, and activities, including participation in implementation and oversight, and the development of specific benchmarks to measure progress and outcomes.</text> </paragraph> 
<paragraph id="HCB2682C0B6D5499E9F2F4B6BF0A5C2D3"><enum>(5)</enum><text>Funds will be used to train and deploy additional United States Government direct-hire personnel to improve monitoring and control of assistance.</text> </paragraph> 
<paragraph id="HCE24E4B8A8E44F2D95D3D2E56257BBE7"><enum>(6)</enum><text>A framework and methodology is being utilized to assess national, provincial, local, and sector level fiduciary risks relating to public financial management of United States Government assistance.</text> </paragraph></subsection> 
<subsection id="H44C1B886CC794CBEAF4D699BA7D3E9F2"><enum>(c)</enum><header>Assistance and operations</header> 
<paragraph commented="no" display-inline="yes-display-inline" id="H094BE43A1C844BCEA70F0AFA33269F76"><enum>(1)</enum><text>Funds appropriated by this division under the headings <quote>Economic Support Fund</quote> and <quote>International Narcotics Control and Law Enforcement</quote> that are available for assistance for Afghanistan—</text> 
<subparagraph id="HC9FED224322744B79E5A2F325AEA4BC7"><enum>(A)</enum><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">shall be made available, to the maximum extent practicable, in a manner that emphasizes the participation of Afghan women, and directly improves the security, economic and social well-being, and political status, and protects the rights of, Afghan women and girls and complies with sections 7062 and 7063 of division F of <external-xref legal-doc="public-law" parsable-cite="pl/111/117">Public Law 111–117</external-xref>, including support for the Afghan Independent Human Rights Commission, the Afghan Ministry of Women's Affairs, and women-led nongovernmental organizations;</text> </subparagraph> 
<subparagraph id="HA05BCFF5D376410193B73E48D0A9E650"><enum>(B)</enum><text>may be made available for a United States contribution to an internationally-managed fund to support the reconciliation with and disarmament, demobilization, and reintegration into Afghan society of, former combatants who have renounced violence against the Government of Afghanistan: <italic>Provided</italic>, That funds may be made available to support reconciliation and reintegration activities only if—</text> 
<clause id="H808A2C071CCA44E79309EA501D1F470E"><enum>(i)</enum><text>Afghan women are participating at national, provincial, and local levels of government in the design, policy formulation and implementation of the reconciliation or reintegration process, and such process upholds steps taken by the Government of Afghanistan to protect the internationally recognized human rights of Afghan women; and</text> </clause> 
<clause id="H9453B23261ED42AB8420C146689D98D3"><enum>(ii)</enum><text>such funds will not be used to support any pardon or immunity from prosecution, or any position in the Government of Afghanistan or security forces, for any leader of an armed group responsible for crimes against humanity, war crimes, or other violations of internationally recognized human rights;</text> </clause></subparagraph> 
<subparagraph id="H1C2EFA4A8EEE49079C003F9F5B46A08C"><enum>(C)</enum><text>may be made available as a United States contribution to the Afghanistan Reconstruction Trust Fund (ARTF) unless the Secretary of State determines and reports to the Committees on Appropriations that the World Bank Monitoring Agent of the ARTF is unable to conduct its financial control and audit responsibilities due to restrictions on security personnel by the Government of Afghanistan; and</text> </subparagraph> 
<subparagraph id="H371A6C33688F4B3BA5D9D7D43A0F3CDD"><enum>(D)</enum><text>may be made available for a United States contribution to the North Atlantic Treaty Organization/International Security Assistance Force Post-Operations Humanitarian Relief Fund.</text> </subparagraph></paragraph> 
<paragraph id="H81DC527E1D4E4559BD9DD0A3B08AEF21"><enum>(2)</enum><text>Funds appropriated under the headings <quote>Economic Support Fund</quote> and <quote>International Narcotics Control and Law Enforcement</quote> by this division that are available for assistance for Afghanistan that provide training for foreign police, judicial, and military personnel shall address, where appropriate, gender-based violence.</text> </paragraph> 
<paragraph id="H4F1C6E9229954CE69B8D29C3DA0EE4CB"><enum>(3)</enum><text>The authority contained in section 1102(c) of <external-xref legal-doc="public-law" parsable-cite="pl/111/32">Public Law 111–32</external-xref> shall continue in effect during fiscal year 2011 and shall apply as if included in this division.</text> </paragraph> 
<paragraph id="H25054B4AC77C4ABE858B27D8F8B72A46"><enum>(4)</enum><text>The Coordinator for Rule of Law at the United States Embassy in Kabul, Afghanistan, shall be consulted on the use of all funds appropriated by this division for rule of law programs in Afghanistan.</text> </paragraph> 
<paragraph id="HBBB55929696147C9864E492C561894BA"><enum>(5)</enum><text>None of the funds made available by this division may be used by the United States Government to enter into a permanent basing rights agreement between the United States and Afghanistan.</text> </paragraph> 
<paragraph id="HA751A1E3C89E455CA6656B02EE28A74F"><enum>(6)</enum><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">The Secretary of State, after consultation with the USAID Administrator, shall submit to the Committees on Appropriations not later than 45 days after enactment of this division, and prior to the initial obligation of funds for assistance for Afghanistan, a detailed spending plan for such assistance which shall include clear and achievable goals, benchmarks for measuring progress, and expected results: <italic>Provided</italic>, That such plan shall not be considered as meeting the notification requirements under section 7015 of division F of <external-xref legal-doc="public-law" parsable-cite="pl/111/117">Public Law 111–117</external-xref> or under section 634A of the Foreign Assistance Act of 1961.</text> </paragraph></subsection> 
<subsection id="H0F8399F54FE247E7BA279F4581C68E30"><enum>(d)</enum><header>Oversight</header> 
<paragraph commented="no" display-inline="yes-display-inline" id="H22DA610BEBE543EDB193695FD0FA10A7"><enum>(1)</enum><text>The Special Inspector General for Afghanistan Reconstruction, the Inspector General of the Department of State, and the Inspector General of the United States Agency for International Development, shall jointly develop and submit to the Committees on Appropriations within 45 days of enactment of this division a coordinated audit and inspection plan of United States assistance for, and civilian operations in, Afghanistan.</text> </paragraph></subsection> 
<subsection id="HA37A6A822CAC42C2A8A11B0BCEE91449"><enum>(2)</enum><text>Of the funds appropriated by this division under the heading <quote>Economic Support Fund</quote> for assistance for Afghanistan, $3,000,000 shall be transferred to, and merged with, funds appropriated by this division under the heading <quote>Administration of Foreign Affairs, Office of Inspector General</quote>, for increased oversight of programs in Afghanistan and shall be in addition to funds otherwise available for such purposes: <italic>Provided</italic>, That $1,500,000 shall be for the activities of the Special Inspector General for Afghanistan Reconstruction.</text> </subsection> 
<subsection id="H29C7DE0451F64C61A85E870B22B68EE4"><enum>(3)</enum><text>Of the funds appropriated by this division under the heading <quote>Economic Support Fund</quote> for assistance for Afghanistan, $1,500,000 shall be transferred to, and merged with, funds appropriated by this division under the heading <quote>United States Agency for International Development, Funds Appropriated to the President, Office of Inspector General</quote> for increased oversight of programs in Afghanistan and shall be in addition to funds otherwise available for such purposes.</text> </subsection> 
<subsection id="HAADBA6411CDD47238E59FF015E1FC8E6"><enum>(e)</enum><header>Modification to prior provisions</header> 
<paragraph commented="no" display-inline="yes-display-inline" id="H92F248B28B2A410AB3997636BA10AA75"><enum>(1)</enum><text>Section 1004(c)(1)(C) of <external-xref legal-doc="public-law" parsable-cite="pl/111/212">Public Law 111–212</external-xref> is amended to read as follows:</text> 
<quoted-block display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H46818267A2CD40048A02C0F4FBB25207" style="appropriations"> 
<subparagraph id="HDE0870498A734783AD68D1031F3C9780"><enum>(C)</enum><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">taking credible steps to protect the internationally recognized human rights of Afghan women.</text> </subparagraph><after-quoted-block>.</after-quoted-block></quoted-block> </paragraph></subsection> 
<subsection id="HB854758575684EE2B81E8C2B8AD8B64E"><enum>(2)</enum><text>Section 1004(d)(1) of <external-xref legal-doc="public-law" parsable-cite="pl/111/212">Public Law 111–212</external-xref> is amended to read as follows:</text> 
<quoted-block display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H681E50BB1DB644908FEE19AD4A90D9D1" style="appropriations"> 
<paragraph id="HCEBC1232ADA74DBEA38052F90816843F"><enum>(1)</enum><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">Afghan women are participating at national, provincial, and local levels of government in the design, policy formulation, and implementation of the reconciliation or reintegration process, and such process upholds steps taken by the Government of Afghanistan to protect the internationally recognized human rights of Afghan women; and</text> </paragraph><after-quoted-block>.</after-quoted-block></quoted-block> </subsection> 
<subsection id="H3EC4FDE7522749BFAB867E2C7FEEF8AE"><enum>(3)</enum><text>Section 1004(e)(1) of <external-xref legal-doc="public-law" parsable-cite="pl/111/212">Public Law 111–212</external-xref> is amended to read as follows:</text> 
<quoted-block display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H5907CBE51D994FD48AA23933A893526E" style="appropriations"> 
<paragraph id="H32779BC61DD544498C51DD7F95E537E0"><enum>(1)</enum><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">based on information available to the Secretary, the Independent Electoral Commission has no members or other employees who participated in, or helped to cover up, acts of fraud in the 2009 presidential election in Afghanistan, and the Electoral Complaints Commission is a genuinely independent body with all the authorities that were invested in it under Afghan law as of December 31, 2009; and</text> </paragraph><after-quoted-block>.</after-quoted-block></quoted-block> </subsection></section> 
<section id="HBC09868B9610409BB9A7B2152C873683"><enum>2123.</enum> 
<subsection commented="no" display-inline="yes-display-inline" id="H71856588C1C74BE68370E8BBA698501B"><enum>(a)</enum><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">The first and second provisos under the heading <quote>Bilateral Economic Assistance, Funds Appropriated to the President, Economic Support Fund</quote> in division F of <external-xref legal-doc="public-law" parsable-cite="pl/111/117">Public Law 111–117</external-xref> shall be applied to funds appropriated by this division by substituting the following: <quote><italic>Provided</italic>, That of the funds appropriated under this heading, up to $250,000,000 shall be made available for assistance for Egypt for activities that support democratic elections, promote representative and accountable governance, protect human rights, strengthen civil society and the rule of law, reduce poverty, promote equitable economic development, and expand educational opportunities for disadvantaged Egyptian youth, including through scholarship programs: <italic>Provided further</italic>, That the Secretary of State shall submit a spending plan, including a comprehensive strategy to promote democracy and development, to the Committees on Appropriations for funds provided for Egypt under this heading: <italic>Provided further</italic>, That such plan shall not be considered as meeting the notification requirements under section 7015 of division F of <external-xref legal-doc="public-law" parsable-cite="pl/111/117">Public Law 111–117</external-xref> or under section 634A of the Foreign Assistance Act of 1961: <italic>Provided further</italic>, That such funds shall be subject to the regular notification procedures of the Committees on Appropriations: <italic>Provided further</italic>, That funds appropriated under this heading shall be made available to support democratic transitions in the Middle East and North Africa, including assistance for civil society organizations and the development of democratic political parties:</quote> .</text> </subsection> 
<subsection id="HD3CFE95164074339B6F24EB202928FAE"><enum>(b)</enum><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">Not later than 45 days after enactment of this Act, the Secretary of State shall submit to the Committees on Appropriations a report on Egypt detailing whether—</text> 
<paragraph id="H63590EE8F89E425497AA2677C69DFF91"><enum>(1)</enum><text>a transparent, political transition is occurring that includes the participation of a wide range of democratic opposition and civil society leaders and is responsive to their views;</text> </paragraph> 
<paragraph id="HE9ED3B0337044F0AB80F3FC0FAF3F408"><enum>(2)</enum><text>the emergency law and other laws restricting human rights have been abrogated; protesters, political and social activists and journalists are not being arrested, detained or prosecuted for the peaceful exercise of their rights; and the government is respecting freedoms of expression, assembly and association; and</text> </paragraph> 
<paragraph id="H92117C7C7BD2491D9A1D571F17FD799A"><enum>(3)</enum><text>legal and constitutional impediments to free and fair presidential and parliamentary elections are being removed.</text> </paragraph></subsection></section> 
<section id="H483A7F5B5B3F4D7497D8EAECD78D0562"><enum>2124.</enum><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">Notwithstanding section 1101, the level for “Multilateral Assistance, International Financial Institutions, Contribution to the Global Agriculture and Food Security Program”, shall be $100,000,000 for payment to the Global Agriculture and Food Security Program by the Secretary of the Treasury, to remain available until expended.</text> </section> 
<section id="H332E1926ECB04C67AE5DD4AA674D49DD"><enum>2125.</enum><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">None of the funds made available in this division for the United Nations Capital Master Plan may be used for the design, renovation, or construction of the United Nations Headquarters in New York in excess of the agreed upon assessments of the United States pursuant to paragraph 10 of United Nations General Assembly Resolution 61/251.</text> </section> 
<section id="HCB627F6049E34BEE89F3F6F66B8E0E20"><enum>2126.</enum> 
<subsection commented="no" display-inline="yes-display-inline" id="H79662E5CD6274D4A9C3E0F0139B0141F"><enum>(a)</enum><header>Contribution to the Asian Development Bank</header><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">In addition to amounts otherwise made available by this division, $106,586,000, to remain available until expended, is appropriated for payment to the Asian Development Bank by the Secretary of the Treasury for the United States share of the paid-in portion of the increase in capital stock.</text> </subsection> 
<subsection id="H1328B99720A04FC8BE810139E1D5B91D"><enum>(b)</enum><header>Limitation on Callable Capital Subscriptions</header><text>The United States Governor of the Asian Development Bank may subscribe without fiscal year limitation to the callable capital portion of the United States share of such capital stock in an amount not to exceed $2,558,048,769.</text> </subsection> 
<subsection id="H3C9974C9CFC74CC490B6E4A8362AD4A0"><enum>(c)</enum><header>Reporting on Reforms</header><text>Funds shall not be made available for a United States contribution to the Asian Development Bank (ADB) until the Secretary of the Treasury reports to the Committees on Appropriations that the ADB is making substantial progress toward the following policy goals—</text> 
<paragraph id="HDC9861F038334837BFBA426589A4C4DC"><enum>(1)</enum><text>implementing procurement guidelines that maximize international competitive bidding in accordance with sound procurement practices, including transparency, competition, and cost-effective results for Borrowers;</text> </paragraph> 
<paragraph id="H4A3AFE4EC3DE4A4FB39A5436E0CC0967"><enum>(2)</enum><text>providing greater public disclosure of loan documents, with particular attention to persons affected by ADB projects;</text> </paragraph> 
<paragraph id="HCF4B97FC506A478A8A9E110F71F2DDA8"><enum>(3)</enum><text>implementing best practices in domestic laws and international conventions against corruption for whistleblower and witness disclosures, and protections against retaliation for internal and lawful public disclosures by ADB employees and others affected by ADB operations who report illegality or other misconduct that could threaten the ADB’s mission, including best practices for legal burdens of proof; access to independent adjudicative bodies; and results that eliminate the effects of proven retaliation;</text> </paragraph> 
<paragraph id="H4F2F0D3FE2664DBFA45CEAB8E9F68AE2"><enum>(4)</enum><text>ensuring that the Investigations Office, Auditor General Office, and Evaluation Office are functionally independent, free from interference when determining the scope of investigations and audits, performing work and communicating results, and regularly report to the ADB’s board of directors and, as appropriate and in a manner consistent with such functional independence of the Investigations Office and the Auditor General Office, to the ADB President;</text> </paragraph> 
<paragraph id="H217565B632C34EA991A733E4F2C1A040"><enum>(5)</enum><text>requiring that each candidate for adjustment or budget support loans provide an assessment of reforms to budgetary and procurement processes to encourage transparency, including budget publication and public scrutiny, prior to loan or grant approval;</text> </paragraph> 
<paragraph id="HF005F582F2574623B5DBA52F089DBA1A"><enum>(6)</enum><text>ensuring that the ADB's Accountability Mechanism provides transparency and protects local residents affected by ADB projects; and</text> </paragraph> 
<paragraph id="HF1559E5E480240F8B19CE8A9035DAB36"><enum>(7)</enum><text>making publicly available external and internal performance and financial audits of ADB projects on the ADB’s website.</text> </paragraph></subsection> 
<subsection id="HCA3BDC031B394FA4A7003072717BD46C"><enum>(d)</enum><header>Report Dates</header><text>Not later than 180 days after enactment of this Act, and every 6 months thereafter until September 30, 2013, the Secretary of the Treasury shall submit to the Committees on Appropriations a report detailing the extent to which the ADB has made progress on each policy goal listed in subsection (c).</text> </subsection> 
<subsection id="HBF33FD4F7FF4485885D45DAB4D1F9CC6"><enum>(e)</enum><header>Amendment</header><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">The Asian Development Bank Act (<external-xref legal-doc="usc" parsable-cite="usc/22/285">22 U.S.C. 285 et seq.</external-xref>), is amended by adding at the end the following:</text> 
<quoted-block display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HAE55B22D9B6A46B399DEAD19B3D6EAC2" style="OLC"> 
<section id="HF339315153AD4DA2B2CC3F3D4E1ED67C"><enum>33.</enum><header>NINTH REPLENISHMENT</header> 
<subsection id="H77E7A84EE20946FA8E6F65A61B8CD2E3"><enum>(a)</enum><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">The United States Governor of the Bank is authorized to contribute, on behalf of the United States, $461,000,000 to the ninth replenishment of the resources of the Fund, subject to obtaining the necessary appropriations.</text> </subsection> 
<subsection id="HAECDEB49E3474133AFEB0D6B9995A0E3"><enum>(b)</enum><text>In order to pay for the United States contribution provided for in subsection (a), there are authorized to be appropriated, without fiscal year limitation, $461,000,000 for payment by the Secretary of the Treasury.</text> </subsection></section> 
<section id="HBBB4A85757E54E32894E70196550AECA"><enum>34.</enum><header>FIFTH CAPITAL INCREASE</header> 
<subsection id="HB8508BC260FC437B82014DD509720327"><enum>(a)</enum><header>Subscription Authorized</header> 
<paragraph id="HB42ED3D56CE44227A9BE823839ECF7B7"><enum>(1)</enum><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">The United States Governor of the Bank may subscribe on behalf of the United States to 1,104,420 additional shares of the capital stock of the Bank.</text> </paragraph> 
<paragraph id="H1C28B1E5FD884387B9F6A97DD7A6B174"><enum>(2)</enum><text>Any subscription by the United States to capital stock of the Bank shall be effective only to such extent or in such amounts as are provided in advance in appropriations Acts.</text> </paragraph></subsection> 
<subsection id="HA407FA31FACE45C5913DB62BEAA1DEFF"><enum>(b)</enum><header>Authorization of Appropriations</header> 
<paragraph id="HAA6CAEB26F3447E7AD6BD7843EC79334"><enum>(1)</enum><text display-inline="yes-display-inline">In order to pay for the increase in the United States subscription to the Bank provided for in subsection (a), there are authorized to be appropriated, without fiscal year limitation, $13,323,173,083, for payment by the Secretary of the Treasury.</text> </paragraph> 
<paragraph id="H533C598787E04570AA8BB4D7EC4E2A62"><enum>(2)</enum><text>Of the amount authorized to be appropriated under paragraph (1)—</text> 
<subparagraph id="HE6D7E01AFB1A451686EA51F90C6D314F"><enum>(A)</enum><text>$532,929,240 is authorized to be appropriated for paid-in shares of the Bank; and</text> </subparagraph> 
<subparagraph id="HEA0DC99A34784F138C7470B81BFB8C66"><enum>(B)</enum><text>$12,790,243,843 is authorized to be appropriated for callable shares of the Bank, for payment by the Secretary of the Treasury.</text> </subparagraph></paragraph></subsection></section><after-quoted-block>.</after-quoted-block></quoted-block> </subsection></section></title>
